東京を始め各地方に
in Tokyo and other places

content:
はじめて〔始めて、初めて〕
〈副〉
1. First; for the first time

content.content: 大砲というものを初めて用いたのはトルコ人が君府を攻囲した時であった
The cannon was first used by the Turks at the siege of Constantinople.
あの人には昨年初めて逢った
I met him for the first time last year.
英語で演説するのは初めてです
I make a speech in English for the first time―This is the first time I make a speech in English―This is my first English speech.
東京は初めてです
I am in Tokyo for the first time―This is my first visit to Tokyo.
彼の失敗は今度が初めてではない
This is not the first time he has failed.［注意］「始(初)めて何々した時」は“When I did so for the first time”と言わずして“The first time I did so”と言う。
彼に初めて逢った時は変な男だと思った
The first time I met his, I thought him a strange fellow.
初めて洋行した時は言葉が通じなくて困った

The first time I went abroad, I could not make myself understood. ［注意］「始(初)めて洋行した人」は“the man who went abroad first”と言わずして“the first man that went abroad”または“the first man to go abroad”と形容詞に訳して(人なる)名詞を形容させる。
僕が初めてついた西洋人は米国人であった
The first foreign teacher I had, was an American.
初めて読んだ英文小説は“The Vicar of Wakefield”
“The Vicar of Wakefield” was the first English novel I ever read.
日本へ初めて来たヨーロッパ人はポルトガル人
The Portuguese were the first Europeans to come to Japan.
日本の地を初めて踏んだ英国人は Adams
Adams was the first Englishman that ever set foot on Japanese soil.
初めて開けた国はエジプト
Egypt was the first country to become civilized.
初めて富士登山をした外国人は Sir Harry Parks
Sir Harry Parks was the first foreigner to make the ascent of Fuji.［注意］「始(初)めて」を打消をもって表わすことあり。
ここは初めてです
I am here for the first time―I have never been here before.
あんな人を見たのは生まれてから初めてだ
I never set eyes on his like in my life.
こんな目に逢ったのはへその緒を切って初めてだ
I never had such an experience in all my born days.［注意］「始めて」を“not till”をもって表わすことあり。
その翌日になって始めて事の真相がわかった
It was not till the next day that I learned the truth.
人は健康を失って始めてそのありがた味を知る
People do not know the blessing of health till they lose it―People then know the value of health when they have lost it.［注意］「始めて」を“then...when”をもって表わすことあり。
政府というものはその必要が無くなって始めて完全な政府である
Government is then perfect when it is unnecessary.
この薬は忘れた頃に始めて利く
The medicine will then take effect when you have forgotten all about it.［注意］「始めて」の意味を“only”をもって表わすことあり。
試してみて始めて不可能なことがわかる
It is only when you have tried that you find it to be impossible―It is only by trying that you know its impossibility.
実見して始めて確信した
It was only when I saw for myself that I was convinced of the fact.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: それは初めて承りました
That is new to me.
こんな光景は初めて見た
The sight is strange to me.
私はこの辺は初めてです
I am a stranger in these parts―I am new to the place.
あの人は初めて逢った人だ
He is a stranger to me.
これは初めてお目にかかります
I am glad to meet you―I am pleased to make your acquaintance.
彼にして始めてできることだ
He alone can do it―He is the only man who can do it.

content:
はじめて〔始めて、初めて〕
〈副〉
1. First; for the first time

content.content: 大砲というものを初めて用いたのはトルコ人が君府を攻囲した時であった
The cannon was first used by the Turks at the siege of Constantinople.
あの人には昨年初めて逢った
I met him for the first time last year.
英語で演説するのは初めてです
I make a speech in English for the first time―This is the first time I make a speech in English―This is my first English speech.
東京は初めてです
I am in Tokyo for the first time―This is my first visit to Tokyo.
彼の失敗は今度が初めてではない
This is not the first time he has failed.［注意］「始(初)めて何々した時」は“When I did so for the first time”と言わずして“The first time I did so”と言う。
彼に初めて逢った時は変な男だと思った
The first time I met his, I thought him a strange fellow.
初めて洋行した時は言葉が通じなくて困った

The first time I went abroad, I could not make myself understood. ［注意］「始(初)めて洋行した人」は“the man who went abroad first”と言わずして“the first man that went abroad”または“the first man to go abroad”と形容詞に訳して(人なる)名詞を形容させる。
僕が初めてついた西洋人は米国人であった
The first foreign teacher I had, was an American.
初めて読んだ英文小説は“The Vicar of Wakefield”
“The Vicar of Wakefield” was the first English novel I ever read.
日本へ初めて来たヨーロッパ人はポルトガル人
The Portuguese were the first Europeans to come to Japan.
日本の地を初めて踏んだ英国人は Adams
Adams was the first Englishman that ever set foot on Japanese soil.
初めて開けた国はエジプト
Egypt was the first country to become civilized.
初めて富士登山をした外国人は Sir Harry Parks
Sir Harry Parks was the first foreigner to make the ascent of Fuji.［注意］「始(初)めて」を打消をもって表わすことあり。
ここは初めてです
I am here for the first time―I have never been here before.
あんな人を見たのは生まれてから初めてだ
I never set eyes on his like in my life.
こんな目に逢ったのはへその緒を切って初めてだ
I never had such an experience in all my born days.［注意］「始めて」を“not till”をもって表わすことあり。
その翌日になって始めて事の真相がわかった
It was not till the next day that I learned the truth.
人は健康を失って始めてそのありがた味を知る
People do not know the blessing of health till they lose it―People then know the value of health when they have lost it.［注意］「始めて」を“then...when”をもって表わすことあり。
政府というものはその必要が無くなって始めて完全な政府である
Government is then perfect when it is unnecessary.
この薬は忘れた頃に始めて利く
The medicine will then take effect when you have forgotten all about it.［注意］「始めて」の意味を“only”をもって表わすことあり。
試してみて始めて不可能なことがわかる
It is only when you have tried that you find it to be impossible―It is only by trying that you know its impossibility.
実見して始めて確信した
It was only when I saw for myself that I was convinced of the fact.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: それは初めて承りました
That is new to me.
こんな光景は初めて見た
The sight is strange to me.
私はこの辺は初めてです
I am a stranger in these parts―I am new to the place.
あの人は初めて逢った人だ
He is a stranger to me.
これは初めてお目にかかります
I am glad to meet you―I am pleased to make your acquaintance.
彼にして始めてできることだ
He alone can do it―He is the only man who can do it.

はじめまして〔始めまして〕
〈初対面の挨拶〉I am glad to meet you.; I am pleased to make your acquaintance.

content:
はじめる〔始める〕
〈他動〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. To begin (English); to commence (a building); to start (a business); to open (negotiations); to initiate (a reform); to inaugurate (a policy); to launch (an enterprise)

content.content: 英語研究を始める
to begin learning English
彼は英語を始めたばかりだ
He has (only) just begun English―He is a beginner in English.
普請を始める
to commence a building
商売を始める
to start a business
業務を始める
to commence business
けんかを始める
to start a quarrel
銀行と取引を始める
to open an account with a bank
発射を始める
to open fire
討論を始める
to open the debate
交渉を始める
to open negotiations
改革を始める
to initiate a reform―inaugurate a reform
事業を始める
to start an enterprise―launch an enterprise
彼は更に交際を始めた
We have renewed our acquaintance.
彼は更に活動を始めた
He has resumed his activity.

content: 2. To engage in (trade); to embark in (an enterprise); to venture on (a speculation)

content.content: 商売を始めようと思う
I intend to engage in trade―start in business―set up in business―establish myself in business.
彼は冒険事業を始めた
He has embarked in a risky enterprise.
奇抜な投機を始めた
He has ventured on a daring speculation.

content: 3. To enter into (conversation); to go into (business); to fall into (conversation)

content.content: 知らない人と談話を始めた
I entered into conversation with a stranger.
文通を始める
to enter into correspondence―open a correspondence―with a man
商売を始める
to go into business―go into trade
放蕩を始める
to fall into evil courses―strike out into a riotous life
ぜいたくを始める
to launch out into extravagance―launch forth into extravagance
彼は東京へ出て早速遊び方を始めた
He came to town and plunged into the pleasures of the town.
青年は専門の研究を急いで始めたがる
Young men are apt to rush into professional studies.

content: 4. To enter upon

content.content: 商売を始める
to enter upon a commercial career
学問を始める
to enter upon one's studies
英語研究を始める
to enter upon one's English studies
(新任教員が)いつから授業を始めましょうか
When shall I enter upon my duties?
早速授業を始めてお貰い申したい
I wish you to enter upon your duties at once.
戦争を始める
to enter upon a war

content: 5. To take to (teaching); to fall to (eating)

content.content: 酒を始める
to take to drinking
人は無事に苦しむと酒やばくちを始める
When a man has nothing to do, he will take to drinking and gambling.
近頃朝起きを始めた
I have taken to early rising.
食事を始める
to fall to (eating)―sit down to table
ご馳走が出たから始めよう
There is good cheer on the table. Let us fall to!
しかたがないから英語の先生を始めた
Having no other resource, I took to teaching English.
殴り合いを始める
to fall to blows―come to blows
商売を始める
to take to trade
いくらの資本で商売を始める
to start with so much capital
千円の資本で商売を始めた
I started with 1000 yen―started business with 1000 yen.
商売を始めるに資本が無い
I have no capital to start with.
素手で商売を始めた
I started with nothing―I had nothing to start with.
何をし始める
to begin doing something ［注意］“To begin to do”(どうするようになる)と言うべからず
この本を読み始めた
I have begun reading this book.
雨が降り始めた
It has begun raining.

content:
〈自動〉
1. To begin

content.content: さかさまに始める
to begin at the wrong end
さあ始めるぞ
Here goes!
それは今に始めぬことだ
That is an old story.
何から始める
to begin with something
この本のうちどれから読み始めようか
Which of these books shall I begin with?
フランス語とドイツ語とどちらから始めた方がよかろうか
Which had I better begin with, French or German?
もう三章を始めたのか―三章から始めたのだ
Have you begun the Third Chapter already?―We began with the Third Chapter.
乞う隗{かい}より始めよ
Begin with No.1.

content:
はしゃ〔覇者〕
〈名〉A potentate

content.content: 海上の覇者
England is the mistress of the seas.

content:
ばしゃ〔馬車〕
〈名〉A carriage:(小形なら)a trap; a dog-cart

content.content: 馬が馬車を引く
A horse draws a carriage.
馬車に馬をつける
to harness the horses to the carriage―(は正式な言い方なれども普通は)―put the horses to
馬車に乗る
to ride in a carriage
今に馬車に乗る身になる
I shall ride in my carriage yet.
馬車に乗り込む
to get into a carriage
馬車から下りる
to get out of a carriage―alight from a carriage
馬車を駆る
to drive a carriage
馬車を駆って上野へ行った
I drove to Ueno.
馬車で行く
to go by carriage―drive
馬車で停車場へ行った
I drove to the station.
馬車で友人を停車場まて送った
I drove a friend to the station.
馬車で公園へ行こう
Let us drive to the Park―drive through the Park.
馬車で出かける
to drive out―go for a drive
父は馬車で出かけました
Father has gone for a drive.
馬車でお迎えに出します
I shall send a carriage for you.
馬車が待っている(待たしてある)
I have a carriage waiting for me.
馬車が盛んに走って通る
A carriage sweeps past.
馬車が平かに走る
A carriage bowls along.
馬車が通るからよけよ
Get out of the way of the carriage.
馬車が玄関に着く
A carriage pulls up at the door.
馬車が威勢よく玄関に着く
A carriage dashes up to the door.
馬車を抱える
to keep a carriage
お宅には馬車がありますか
Do you keep a carriage?
君は馬車ぐらいは抱えられる身分だ
You are rich enough to keep a carriage.
御料馬車
an Imperial carriage―a state carriage
お馬車の前後に騎兵がつく
The Imperial carriage is escorted by cavalry before and behind.
乗合馬車
a coach―a stage-coach―(市街のなら)―an omnibus―a 'bus(と略す)
辻馬車
a cab―a hansom
貸馬車
a hackney-coach
継立馬車
a post-chaise
商人馬車
a gig
荷馬車
a cart―a wagon
郵便馬車
a mail-cart
護送馬車
a prison-van―(英国にては)―the Black Maria
一頭馬車
a one-horse carriage
二頭立(四頭立、六頭立)の馬車
a carriage and pair―a carriage and four―a carriage and six

ばしゃうま〔馬車馬〕
〈名〉A carriage-horse; a coach-horse

content:
はしゃぐ
〈自動〉
1. (=乾燥する)to dry up; to parch

content.content: 土地がはしゃいでいる
The soil is parched.

content: 2. (=面白がって騒ぐ)to frolic; to have a merry fit

content.content: この子は時々はしゃぎ出す
The girl is subject to merry fits.
今もはしゃいでいる
She is having a merry fit.

はじゃけんせい〔破邪顕正〕
〈名〉Preaching the truth and combating error; militancy; iconoclasm

ばしゃちん〔馬車賃〕
〈名〉A coach fare

ばしゃてつどう〔馬車鉄道〕
〈名〉A horse tramway

はじゃのけん〔破邪の剣〕
〈名〉The sword of the spirit

ばしゃまわし〔馬車廻し〕
〈名〉A carriage-drive, a drive (inside the gate)

ばしゃみち〔馬車道〕
〈名〉A carriage-drive, a drive (in a park, etc.)

content:
はしゅつ〔派出〕
〈名〉Despatch:(=する) to despatch; to send out

content.content: 軍艦を派出する
to despatch a warship
看護婦を派出する
to send out nurses
巡査派出所
a police-box

content:
ばじゅつ〔馬術〕
〈名〉Riding; horsemanship; man?ge; equitation

content.content: 馬術を練習する
to take lessons in horsemanship―practise riding
彼は馬術を好くする
He is a good rider―a good horseman―at home in the saddle―(女なら)―She is a good horsewoman.
馬術の先生
a riding-master
馬術学校
a riding-school―a man?ge

content:
ばしょ〔場所〕
〈名〉
1. (=所)a place:(小さい地点なら)a spot

content.content: 時と場所を指定する
to appoint the time and place
指定の場所
the appointed place
場所がまだ決まらない
The place is not yet fixed upon.
時と場所が決まったら知らせて下さい
If the time and place are decided upon, please let me know.
時と場所が判然と言ってない
The exact time and place are not mentioned.
場所を変えて飲み直そう
Let us start afresh in some other place.
金の隠してある場所をくわしく知っている
I know the exact spot where the treasure is concealed.

content: 2. (=物の在る場所、在りし場所、在らんとする場所)the site (of anything, past, present or future); the seat (of authority, learning, war, etc.)

content.content: その建物のある場所はどこか
Where is the site of the building?
ここが城のあった場所だ
This is the site of the castle.
ここが学校の建つ場所です
This is the site assigned for the new school.
平和会議の場所はパリと決まった
Paris was fixed upon as the seat of the peace conference.

content: 3. (=事のありし場所)the scene (of a battle, etc.)

content.content: 大げんかのあった場所はどこだ
Where is the scene of the great quarrel?
ここが一件のあった場所だ
This is the scene of the late affair.
小説中の出来事のありし場所は満洲になっている
The scene of the story is laid in Manchuria.

content: 4. (=入る場所)room; space; ground

content.content: まだ入る場所があるか
Is there room for more?
もう入る場所は無い
There is no room for more.
まだ一人だけ入る場所がある
There is room for one more.
皆入るだけの場所が無い
There is not room enough for all―no room for all.
場所をあける
to make room―clear a space
君だけ場所をあけて入れて上げます
I will make room for you.
場所をふさぐ
to take up room―occupy much space―cover much ground
場所狭隘
We are pinched for room―pressed for room―cramped for space―confined for space.

content: 5. (=坐る場所)a seat; a place

content.content: 坐る場所が無かったから終始立ちづめだった
There was no seat left, and I kept standing all the time.
まだ場所があいているか
Are there any seats left?
場所が皆ふさがっている
The seats are all occupied―The places are all taken.
(芝居などの)場所をとっておく
to book a seat―take a place―(興行者の方から言えば)―reserve a seat for one
場所を二つとってくれ
Take two places for me―(興行者に向かって言えば)―Reserve two seats for me.
場所を二つとって貰った
I have two places taken for me―have two seats reserved for me.

content: 6. (=場所柄)situation; location; a locality; the locale

content.content: 学校は場所が好い
The school is well situated―well located.
場所が悪い
The school is badly situated―badly located.
場所が好いから生徒が集まる
There are many students owing to the goodness of the location―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The goodness of the location accounts for the large number of students.
場所が悪いから生徒が集まらぬ
There are few students owing to the badness of the situation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The badness of the situation accounts for the small number of students.
ここは場所が悪いから好いところを探している
The situation is bad―The locale is bad―so we are looking out for a better place.
商売は場所で繁昌する
Good business depends upon the locality―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The locality brings the business.
場所を開く
to open up a locality
場所が開ける
A locality opens up.
目抜の場所
a first-class locality―a smart quarter

content: 7. (=場末に対する場所)a principal locality; a centre

content.content: 日本橋は場所だから家賃を従って高い
Nihonbashi is a business centre, and the rents are accordingly high.
神楽坂はなかなか場所だ
Kagurazaka is a good locality―one of the centres of the city.

content: 8. (=相撲の場所)the wrestling-matches

content.content: 本場所
the Annual Matches
五月場所
the Summer Matches
場所を踏む
to go through the mill
高等教育の場所を踏んだ人
He has been through the mill of liberal education.
道楽場所を踏んだ男
He has been through the mill of fashionable society.

content:
ばしょう〔芭蕉〕
〈名〉The banana; the plantain

content.content: 芭蕉の実
bananas

content:
ばじょう〔馬上〕
〈形〉Mounted; equestrian:(副詞に用いれば) on horseback

content.content: 馬上の姿
a mounted figure
馬上の像
an equestrian statue
馬上で行こう
Let us go on horseback.

ばじょうじゅう〔馬上銃〕
〈名〉A carbine

はじょうせん〔波状線〕
〈名〉A wavy line

ばじょうぞう〔馬上像〕
〈名〉An equestrian statue

はじょうち〔波状地〕
〈名〉An undulating country; a rolling plain

はしょうふう〔破傷風〕
〈名〉Lockjaw; tetanus

content:
ばしょがら〔場所柄〕
〈名〉Situation; location; a locality; the locale

content.content: 場所柄が好いから商売が繁昌するのだ
There is good business owing to the goodness of the location―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The location accounts for the good business.
商売は場所柄で繁昌する
Good business depends on the locality―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The locality brings the business.

content:
ばしょく〔馬謖〕
〈名〉

content.content: 涙を揮って馬謖を斬る{なみだをふるってばしょくをきる}
to sacrifice love to principle

content:
ばしょくする〔馬食する〕
〈自動〉To gluttonize; to gormandize

content.content: 牛飲馬食する
to eat and drink heartily

content:
はしょる〔端折る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=端を折る)to tuck up

content.content: 裾をはしょる
to tuck up the skirt
尻をはしょる
to tuck up one's skirts

content: 2. (=省略する)to omit; to cut short

content.content: 委しい事をはしょって話そう
I will omit the details.
長い話をはしょって言えば
To make a long story short,...

content:
はしら〔柱〕
〈名〉
1. A post:(標柱)a pillar:(円柱)a column:(電柱などは)a pole

content.content: 柱を立てる
to set up a post―erect a pillar
大黒柱
the main post
電信柱
a telegraph-pole
柱時計
a wall-clock
柱暦
a sheet-calendar
柱隠し
a post-ornament

content: 2. (=支柱)a support; a prop; a stay

content.content: 彼は息子を杖とも柱とも頼んでいる
His son is his only prop and stay.
杖とも柱とも頼む息子に死なれた
He lost a son who was his sole prop and stay.

content: 3. (=貝の柱)the ligament (of a bivalve)

はじらう〔羞う〕
〈自動〉To be coy; to be shy (of strangers)

content:
はしらす〔走らす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=疾走せしむ)to sail, run (a ship)

content.content: 快遊船を走らす
to sail a yacht

content: 2. (=敗走せしむ)to put (the enemy) to flight; to rout (the enemy); to put (the enemy) to rout

content.content: 大に敵を走らす
We routed the enemy―put the enemy to rout.
筆を走らす
to drive a pen
手紙は万年筆で軽く走らしてあった
The letter was dashed off with a fountain-pen.

content:
はしり〔走り〕
〈名〉
1. (=疾走)a run

content.content: ひと走り走る
to have a run
ひと走り行って医者を呼んで来よう
I will run for the doctor.

content: 2. (=初物)the firstlings of the season

content.content: 三馬の走り
the first mackerel-pikes of the season

はしりがき〔走り書き〕
〈名〉A running hand; a scrawl:(=する) to scrawl; to scratch; to dash off

はしりこす〔走り越す〕
〈名〉To outrun, outstrip (one's competitor)

はしりじ〔走り痔〕
〈名〉Bleeding piles

はしりづかい〔走り使い〕
〈名〉(事)running errands:(人)an errand-boy:(=する) to run errands

はしりとび〔走り飛び〕
〈名〉Running jump

はしりよみ〔走り読み〕
〈名〉Cursory reading:(=する) to read cursorily; to skim over (a book)

content:
はしる〔走る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=疾走する)to run:(船なら)to sail; to run:(汽船なら)to steam; to run

content.content: 汽車が全速力で走っている
The train is running at full speed.
この汽車は一時間四十マイルの速力で走る
The train runs at the rate of 40 miles an hour―covers 40 miles in an hour.
汽船が全速力で走っている
The steamer is steaming at full speed―running at full speed.
この船は二十ノットの速力で走る
The ship is good for 20 knots.
彼はいっさんに走って来た
He came running at the top of his speed.
ヒタ走りに走って来た
He came running as fast as his legs could carry him.
彼はイダテン走りに走る
He runs like a shot.
彼は走って帰って来た
He came running back―He came back at a run.
もう力が尽きて走れない
There is no run left in me.

content: 2. (=逃げる、逃げ出す)to run away; to show one's heels; to take to one's heels

content.content: 馬走る
A horse got loose―A horse broke loose.
刀が鞘を走る
The swords runs out of the sheath.
腹が走る
I have a running diarrhoea.
極端に走る
to run to extremes―go to excess
名利に走る
to hanker after wealth of fame
利慾に走る
to be greedy―avaricious―covetous

content:
はじる〔恥る〕
〈他動〉
1. To be ashamed of (anything)

content.content: 貧を恥じるは誤れる名誉心である
It is false pride to be ashamed of poverty.
働いて飯を食うのを恥じることはない
One need not be ashamed of working for one's bread―It is honourable to work for one's bread.
己が行為を恥じて自害した
Ashamed of his conduct, he committed suicide―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Shame drove him to suicide.
恥じて赤面する
to blush for shame
恥じて首を垂れる
to hang one's head for shame［注意］「なすを恥る」と「恥じてせぬ」を次のように区別す。
彼は乞食するのを恥じておる
He is ashamed of begging.
彼は恥じて乞食をせぬ
He is ashamed to beg―too proud to beg.［注意］打消せば両形とも意味一致す。
乞食をして恥じぬ
He is not ashamed of begging.
恥じずに乞食をする
He is not ashamed to beg.
学生らは彼と交際することを恥じて交際せぬ
The students are ashamed to be seen in his company.
僕と交際するを恥じるなら押掛けはせぬ
If you are ashamed of being seen in my company, I will not impose myself upon you.
人生五十功無きを恥じる
A man at fifty should be ashamed of having done nothing.［注意］ 「恥じて何々せぬ」を前置詞(above, beneath)をもって表わすことを得。
あの人は恥じて質問をせぬ
He is ashamed to ask questions―He is too proud to ask questions―He is above asking questions―He considers it beneath him to ask questions.
彼は働いて飯を食うのを恥じて働かぬ
He is ashamed to work for his bread―He is too proud to work for his bread―He is above working for his bread―He considers it beneath his dignity to work for his bread.
彼は年に恥じてそんなことはできまい
He must be above doing such a thing at his age―It would be beneath his years to do such a thing.
彼は地位に恥じてそんなことはできない
It would be beneath his rank to do such a thing.
己が職業を恥じるものではない
One should not be above one's business.
武士は営利的の事業を恥じた
The samurai considered it beneath his dignity―held it infra dig―to engage in lucrative business.

content: 2. (=照れる)to be abashed; to be put out of countenance

content.content: いささかも恥じる様子が無い
He seems not in the least abashed.
彼はどんな目に逢うても恥じるということが無い
Nothing (in the world) can abash him.

content: 3. (=赤面する)to blush

content.content: 君の為に恥じる
I blush for you.
新戦艦は世界いずれの戦艦に比して恥じず
The new battleship need not blush to be compared with any battleship afloat―compares favourably with any battleship afloat.

content: 4. (=似合わぬ)to be unworthy of (a gentleman); to be unbecoming (a gentleman)

content.content: 紳士として恥ずべき行為だ
His conduct is unworthy of a gentleman―unbecoming a gentleman.
彼は紳士に恥じぬ教育を受けている
He has had an education worthy of a gentleman―becoming a gentleman.

content:
5. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 人目を恥じる
to fly the face of man
俯仰天地に愧じず
I have done right in the sight of God and man―I am justified before God and man.

content:
はしわたし〔橋渡し〕
〈名〉Mediation; intermediation

content.content: 橋渡しをする
to mediate between―intermediate between―go between―two parties
彼が橋渡しをしてくれた
He acted as go-between.
友人の橋渡しで会社へ入りました
I have entered the company's service through the good offices of a friend.

content:
はす〔斜〕
〈形〉Oblique; slanting; skew:(=に) obliquely; diagonally; aslant; askew

content.content: 竹を斜にそぐ
to cut a bamboo aslant
額が斜にかかっている
The picture hangs aslant.
貸家札は斜にはる
The notices of houses to let are pasted aslant.

content:
はす〔蓮〕
〈名〉The lotus

content.content: 蓮の花
a lotus flower
蓮の実
lotus seed
蓮の根
a lotus root
蓮池
a lotus pond

content:
はず〔巴豆〕
〈名〉The croton

content.content: ハズ油
croton oil.

content:
はず〔筈〕
〈名〉
1. (=矢筈、弓筈)the notch, the nock (of an arrow); the nocks (of a bow)
2. (=わけ)reason

content.content: 彼にこんなことのできないはずはない
There is no reason why―I see no reason why―he should not be able to do such a thing.［注意］助動詞、形容詞をもって表す場合多し。

content: 3. (=当然の義務)ought; should:(形容詞をもって表わせば)proper

content.content: 借りたものは返すべきはずのものだ
One ought to pay what one owes―It is proper that one should pay what one owes.
彼は一度失敗したからもっと勉強すべきはずだ
He ought to work harder―It is proper that he should work harder―after his failure.
君は借金を払うべきはずだったに(払わなかったのが悪い)
You ought to have paid your debt.
そうあるべきはずだ
That is proper and as it should be.

content: 4. (=当然の結果)ought; should:(形容詞をもって表わせば)natural:(名詞をもって表わせば)no wonder

content.content: 彼はあのように勉強したから成功するはずだ
He ought to succeed―It is quite natural that he should succeed―It is not wonder that he should succeed―after such labours.
あのように勉強したから成功すべきはずだに(せっかく勉強したのに成功しないのがおかしい)
He ought to have succeeded―should have succeeded―after his labours. (It is strange that he should not have succeeded after all his labours)
彼は今朝たったのならもう着くべきはずだに(着かないのがおかしい)
If he started in the morning, he should have arrived by this. (It is strange that he should not have arrived.)
先月誂えたのだから今頃はできているはずだ
I ordered it last month, so it ought to be ready by this.
それもそのはずさ
That is quite natural―only natural―no wonder.

content: 5. (=必然の結果)must:(打消せば)can not:(形容詞をもって表わせば)impossible

content.content: ぜひそうあるべきはずだ
It must needs be so―It must of necessity be so.
そんなはずは無い
It can not be so―It is impossible that it can be so.
この評判が本当なはずが無い
The repot can not be true―It is impossible that the report can be true.
彼は昨夜早く寝たから出かけたはずは無い
He went to bed early last night, so he can not have gone out―it is impossible that he can have gone out.
彼はまだ到着するはずは無い
He can not have arrived yet―It is impossible that he can have arrived yet.
彼は彼女の履歴を知っているはずだ
He must know her antecedents.
知っているはずが無い
He can not know them―It is impossible that he can know them.
知らんはずが無い
He can not be ignorant of them―It is impossible that he can be ignorant of them.
今ここへ置いた物が独りで無くなるはずが無い
It is impossible that what I placed here just now can have disappeared of itself.
彼はそんなはずは無いと言っている
He says it is impossible―He denies the possibility.

content: 6. (=確信)must:(形容詞を代用すれば)I am sure:(打消せば)can not:(形容詞を代用すれば)impossible

content.content: 僕はそう言ったはずだ
I must have said so―I am sure I said so.
金は君に預けたはずだ
I must have given you the money to keep―I am sure I gave you the money to keep.
もっと好いのがあったはずだ
I am sure there was a better one.
僕はそんなことを言うはずは無い
I can not have said so―It is impossible that I can have said so.

content: 7. (=予定)due

content.content: 船は明日到着のはず
The ship is due tomorrow.
今晩は田中が演説をするはずになっている
Tanaka is due to speak this evening.

content: 8. (=予期)to be expected

content.content: 彼は英語を始めたばかりだものこんな本が読めるはずが無い
He has only just begun English, and can not be expected to understand such books.
そんなはずではなかった
That is not what I expected―I did not bargain for that.
それもそのはずさ
That is only to be expected―quite natural―no wonder.

content:
9. 
〈不定法、分詞〉

content.content: 式は来週あるはずだ
The ceremony is to come off next week.
僕は洋行するはずであったが都合があって止めた
I was to have gone abroad, but I gave up the idea for certain reasons.
今日友人が来るはずだ
A friend is coming to see me today―I expect a friend today.

content:
10. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: あんな失錯をしたなら辞職でもするはずだに
I should have thought that he would resign after such a blunder.

ばず〔馬爪〕
〈名〉Imitation tortoise-shell (made from horse-hoof)

content:
はすう〔端数〕
〈名〉A fraction

content.content: 端数を切捨てる
to omit fractions

content:
ばすえ〔場末〕
〈名〉A suburb; the outskirts of a city

content.content: この辺は場末です
We live in the suburbs―on the outskirts of the city.
東京の場末もだんだん開ける
The outskirts of Tokyo are opening up.

content:
はずかしい〔恥ずかしい〕
〈叙述形容詞〉(I am) ashamed (of something)

content.content: 僕は失敗して恥ずかしい
I am ashamed of my failure―I blush at my failure.
お前はそんなことをして恥ずかしくないか
Are you not ashamed of doing such a thing?［注意］「何々するのが恥しい」と「恥かしいから何もせぬ」とは次の如く区別す。
乞食するのが恥ずかしい
I am ashamed of begging.
恥ずかしいから乞食をせぬ
I am ashamed to beg.
僕はつきあうのが恥ずかしいなら押掛けはせぬ
If you are ashamed to be seen in my company, I will not force myself upon you.
あのような日本人があると外国人に対して恥ずかしい
Such men make us ashamed of ourselves before foreigners―humiliate us in the eyes of foreigners.
おー恥ずかしい
Shame on me!
お恥ずかしいことながら身に覚えがあります
To my shamed be it spoken that I am guilty of such conduct.
お恥ずかしい次第ですがそれが無いのです
I must confess to my shame that I have none.
恥ずかしいから暫くかくれていよう
I shall lie close for a while out of shame―through shame.
恥ずかしくてそんなことはできない
I can not do such a thing for very shame.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この絵は商売人が画いたといっても恥ずかしくない
The performance would do credit to a professional.
この文章は学者が書いたといっても恥ずかしくない
The composition would do honour to a scholar.
紳士として恥ずかしくない行為だ
The conduct is worthy of a gentleman.
これなら停車場といっても恥ずかしくない
This is something like a station―some station.
彼はよく恥ずかしくなく金をくれなどと言えたものだ
I wonder how he can have the impudence to―have the effrontery to―have the cheek to―have the face to―ask for money.

content:
はずかしがり〔恥かしがり〕
〈名〉A shy person; a bashful person; a shamefaced person

content.content: あの人は恥ずかしがりだ
He is shy―bashful.
僕も恥ずかしがりで困る
I can not get over my shyness―can not get over my bashfulness.

content:
はずかしがる〔恥かしがる〕
〈自他動〉To be ashamed (of something); to be shamefaced; to be abashed; to be bashful; to be shy; to be modest:(形容詞に用いれば)shamefaced (person); bashful, modest (maiden); shy (girl, etc.)

content.content: 彼は失敗して恥ずかしがっている
He is ashamed of his failure.［注意］「何々するのを恥ずかしがる」と「恥ずかしがって何々せぬ」を次の如くに区別す。
彼は質問するのを恥ずかしがっている
He is ashamed of asking questions.
恥ずかしがって質問せぬ
He is ashamed to ask questions―He is above asking questions.
恥ずかしがって引込んでいる
He is ashamed to show his face.
恥ずかしがってかくれている
He lies close out of shame―through shame.
彼女は恥ずかしがって伏し目になった
She bashfully looked down.
恥ずかしがる子だ
She is a shy girl―a bashful girl―a shamefaced girl.
生娘だから恥ずかしがる
She is a modest maiden.

content:
はずかしそう〔恥ずかしそう〕
〈形〉Shy; bashful:(=に) shyly; bashfully

content.content: 彼は恥ずかしそうな顔をしている
He looks abashed.
娘は恥ずかしそうに男の顔を見た
She cast a shy glance at him―cast a bashful glance at him.

content:
はずかしめ〔辱め〕
〈名〉
1. (=恥辱)dishonour; disgrace; shame:(=る) to dishonour, disgrace, shame (one's parents or family)

content.content: 家名を辱める
to disgrace one's family―bring dishonour upon one's family
家名を辱むる不孝者
You are a disgrace to your family.

content: 2. (=侮辱)an insult; an affront; an indignity; a slight; a personal offence:(=る) to insult, affront, slight, snub, sit upon (a person)

content.content: 辱めを受ける
to be insulted―be affronted―be slighted―be subjected to indignities
辱めを受けて憤る
to resent an insult
辱めを受けても黙っているような意気地無しだ
He has no spirit to resent an insult.
辱めを忍ぶ
to pocket an insult―swallow an insult―digest an insult―stomach an insult
こんな辱めを受けてはとても忍べない
I can not stomach such an insult.
兄弟牆{かき}に鬩{せめ}げども外辱めを受けず
Party spirit vanishes in presence of national danger.

content: 3. (=屈辱)humiliation:(=る) to humiliate; to humble (one) in the dust

content.content: 敵を辱める
to humiliate a vanquished enemy―humble a fallen enemy in the dust
君辱めらるれば臣死す
When his lord is humiliated, the vassal dies.
女を辱める
to seduce―debauch―rape―ravish―violate―outrage―a woman
信任を辱める
to betray one's confidence
余の信任を辱むるなかれ
You must justify my confidence in you.
ご信任を辱めざらんことを期す
I hope I shall justify your confidence in me.
君命を辱める
to betray one's sovereign's trust
君命を辱めず
He has acquitted himself to his credit.
千里君命を辱めず
He represented his sovereign with credit at a foreign court.

content:
はずす〔外す〕
〈他動〉
1. To unfasten, undo (what is fastened); to unfix (what is fixed); to unhang (what is hung); to disjoin (what is joined); to disconnect (what is connected); to put (anything) out of place; to put (a wheel) out of gear; to disconnect (a wheel); to put (a bone) out of joint; to dislocate (a bone); to remove; to take off; to take out; to take down

content.content: ボタンをはずす
to undo a button―(上衣のボタンなら)―unbutton one's coat
弦をはずす
to unstring a bow―unbend the bow
障子をはずす
to removes the paper-screens―take out the paper-screens
眼鏡をはずす
to take of one's spectacles―remove one's spectacles
看板をはずす
to take down the signboard―remove the signboard
支柱をはずす
to knock off the supports
板をはずす
to unfasten a board―unfix a board―put a board out of place
懸けてある地図をはずす
to unhang a map
戸の錠前をはずす
to unlock the door
戸の掛金をはずす
to unlatch the door
戸の桟をはずす
to unbolt the door
戸のかんぬきをはずす
to unbar the door
馬具をはずす
to unharness a horse
鎖をはずす
to unlink a chain―(犬の鎖なら)―unchain a dog
しめ金をはずす
to unbuckle a strap
留め金をはずす
to unclasp a pocket-book
アゴをはずす
to get one's jaws out of joint
あまり笑ってアゴをはずした
I laughed my jaws out of joint.
的をはずす
to miss the mark
ウンと的をはずした
I shot wide of the mark.
あてたかはずしたか
Hit or miss?
目的をはずす
to miss one's object
機会をはずす
to miss an opportunity―let slip an opportunity―throw away an opportunity
千載一遇の機会をはずして残念なことをした
I am sorry I threw away a golden opportunity.
約束をはずす
to miss an appointment
試験をはずす
to miss an examination
会をはずす
to stay away from a meeting―miss a meeting
場をはずす、座をはずす、席をはずす
to keep out of the way
人が自分のことを話していたから気を利かして場をはずした
They were talking about me, and so I discreetly kept out of the way.
羽目{はめ}をはずす
to abandon oneself to pleasure
はめをはずして騒ぐ
to go on the spree―paint the sky red―have a gay frolic―have a boisterous merry-making
はめをはずして騒いでいる
They are on the spree―painting the town red.

content:
はすっぱ〔蓮葉〕
〈形〉Wanton; light

content.content: あれは、はすっぱな女だ
She is a woman of light character.
はすっぱ娘
a hussy

content:
はすは〔蓮葉〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: はすっぱ〔蓮葉〕

content:
はずべき〔恥ず可き〕
〈形〉Shameful, disgraceful, dishonourable (conduct); discreditable (performance); disreputable (appearance); humiliating (defeat); infamous (trade); scandalous (transaction); unworthy (conduct, etc.)

content.content: 自国語を知らぬのは恥ずべきことだ
It is a disgrace not to know one's own language.
労働は恥ずべきものでない
Labour is honourable.
紳士として恥ずべき行為だ
His conduct is unworthy of a gentleman.
それは良心に恥ずべきやり方だ
That is an unconscientious way of doing things.

content:
はずみ〔機勢〕
〈名〉
1. (=反跳)bounce; bound; rebound

content.content: ゴム毬ははずみが好い
An india-rubber ball bounces well―bounds well.

content: 2. (=動量)momentum

content.content: 動くものははずみがつく
A moving body is impelled by its momentum.
車ははずみがついてすぐには止まらぬ
The car, impelled by its momentum,will not stop at once.

content: 3. (=刺戟)impulse; impetus; stimulus; inspiration

content.content: 試験は勉強のはずみになる
Examinations give an impetus to study―act as impetus to study.
競技者は見物人があるとはずみがつく
The competitors are stimulated by the presence of spectators―inspired by the audience.
あの人はその時のはずみで何を言うかわかったものじゃない
There is no saying what he will say on the impulse of the moment―on the spur of the moment.
時のはずみでどんな嘘でも吐く
He will tell any number of lies on the spur of the moment.
つい激したはずみに失礼なことを申しましたろう
You must excuse me for the hasty words which must have escaped me in the heat of the argument―in the heat of the debate―in the heat of the moment.
話しのはずみに余計なことを言ってしまった
I was carried away by the heat of the talk.

content: 4. (=偶然)chance

content.content: 彼はどうしたはずみか失敗した
He failed by some chance.
ちょっとしたはずみでうまくいった
The thing went well by the merest chance.
二人は妙なはずみで夫婦になった
They became man and wife by a strange chance―It was strange chance that made them man and wife.

content: 5. (=拍子)the moment (of doing something)

content.content: 自動車をよけるはずみに転んだ
I fell in trying to dodge a motor-car.
梯子段を駆け上がるはずみにすべった
I slipped when running up the stairs.

content:
はずむ
〈自動〉
1. (=反跳する)to bounce; to bound; to rebound

content.content: ゴム毬はよくはずむ
An india-rubber ball bounces well―bounds well.
球が落ちてはずむ
A fallen ball rebounds.

content: 2. (=調子づく)to be stimulated; to be animated; to be inspired; to be spurred on

content.content: 見物人があると競技者がはずむ
The competitors are stimulated by the presence of spectators―inspired by the audience.
トントン拍子に行ったので気がはずんだ
I was spurred on by easy successes―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Easy successes spurred me on.
話がはずんできた
The talk became animated.

content:
〈他動〉
1. (=奮発する)to come down with (a big sum); to invest in, treat oneself to (some luxury)

content.content: 茶代がはずむと取扱いが違う
If you come down with a big tea-money, they will make much of you.
少し儲かったから金時計をはずんだ
I made rather a good thing, and invested in a gold watch―treated myself to a gold watch.
息をはずましてものを言う
to speak excitedly―in excitement

content:
はずる〔恥る〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: はじる〔恥る〕

content:
はずれ〔外れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=端)the extremities (of a place); the outskirts (of a town)

content.content: その家は町はずれだ
The house stands on the outskirts of the city.

content: 2. (=不命中)miss

content.content: 当たりかはずれか
Hit or miss?

content: 3. (=失敗、不作)failure

content.content: 今年の養蚕ははずれた
The sericulture has failed this year.
今度の芝居ははずれた
The new play is a failure.

content: 〈接尾詞〉Out of...

content.content: 場合はずれ
out of place―out of season
あの人の言うことはいつも場合はずれだ
His remarks are always out of place―malapropos.
調子はずれ
(名詞に訳せば)a false note―(副詞に訳せば)―out of tune
調子はずれの声を出す
He will sing out of tune.
時候はずれ
out of season
時候はずれの陽気
It is unseasonable weather.

content:
はずれる〔外れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=あるべきところから離れる)(what is in) comes out; (what is on) comes off; (what is in place) gets out of place; (a wheel) gets out of gear, becomes disconnected; (a bone) gets out of joint, becomes dislocated

content.content: 戸がはずれる
A sliding-door comes out (of the groove).
この障子は始終はずれる
The paper-screen is constantly slipping out.
またはずれた
It is out again.
電車の棒がはずれる
A trolley-pole comes off (the wire).
またはずれた
It is off again.
アゴがはずれた
My jaws are out of joint―dislocated.
車がはずれた
The wheel is out of gear―disconnected.
桶の箍がはずれた
The hoop has come off (the tub)―The hoop if off.
板がはずれた
The board is out of place.
ボタンはずれる
A button comes undone―(靴のボタンなら)―A shoe comes unbuttoned.
君のズボンのボタンがはずれている
“Your stable-door is open.”
彼の声は調子がはずれている
He sings out of tune.
あの男は調子がはずれている
He is cranky.

content: 2. (=失敗する)to fail; to go wrong

content.content: 農作物がはずれる
A crop fails.
今度の芝居ははずれた
The new play is a failure.
ヤマがはずれる
A speculation fails.
目算がはずれる
to miscalculate
目算がはずれた
My scheme has failed―gone wrong.
することなすこと皆はずれた
I am disappointed at every turn―“driven from pillar to post.”
この方法ははずれッこは無い
This method never fails―It is an infallible method―a sure way.
当てがはずれる

A bird flaps its wings.
旗が風でバタバタする
A flags flaps in the wind.
戸が風でバタバタ煽る
A door flaps in the wind―bangs in the wind―slams in the wind.
バタバタはたきをかける
to dust with a flapping noise―make a noise with the duster
お転婆娘が廊下をバタバタ駈けて歩く
A romping girl bounces along the passages.
いたずら子をつかまえると足をバタバタして暴れる
A mischievous urchin, when caught, will kick and struggle.
兵がバタバタ倒れた
The men were dropping on every side―The men fell one after another―Man after man fell.
五六人バタバタ倒れた
Five or six men fell one after another.
商業界の恐慌で銀行がバタバタ倒れた
In the commercial crisis, the banks failed one after another―went down like ninepins.
彼は早く行きたがってバタバタしている
He is impatient to be gone.
用をバタバタ片づけた
I finished my business with despatch―I despatched my business.
用がバタバタ片づく
Business is despatched.
芝居がバタバタになる
Running messengers rush into the scene.

content:
パタパタ
〈擬音詞〉(The sound of) pattering or fluttering; pit-a-pat

content.content: 鼠がパタパタ走る
Mice go pit-a-pat―go pattering.
蝶が羽根をパタパタする
A butterfly flutters.

はたび〔旗日〕
〈名〉A national holiday

はたまた〔将又〕
〈副〉Moreover; further; again

content:
はだみ〔肌身〕
〈名〉
1. (=肌、身体)the skin; one's person

content.content: (守りなどを)肌身離さず身につけている
to wear a talisman next the skin―carry about an amulet on one's person

content: 2. (=貞操)female honour; chastity

content.content: 女が男に肌身を許す
A woman surrenders her chastity to a man―sacrifices her honour to a man―gives herself to a man―admits his embraces.
女の肌身をけがす
to dishonour a woman―(淫売をするの意味なら)―prostitute oneself
女が肌身をけがされる
A woman is dishonoured.
すんでのことに肌身をけがされるところであった
She came near being dishonoured.
肌身は潔白だ
Her honour is unsullied.

はたもと〔旗本〕
〈名〉An immediate vassal of the Shogun; a banneret

content:
はたらかす〔働かす〕
〈他動〉
1. To exercise (the faculties); to use (one's head); to set (one's wits) to work; to give play to, give scope to, give swing to (one's genius); to call (one's genius) into play

content.content: 筋肉を働かす
to exercise the muscles
想像力を働かす
to exercise the imagination
少し頭を働かせればできることだ
It may be done if you will use your head a little.
智慧を働かせなくてはできない
It can not be done unless you set your wits to work.
天才を充分に働かせることのできる専門を選べ
You should choose a profession which can give free play to―give ample scope to―give full swing to―your genius.
才能を働かせることのできる事業をせよ
Engage in some work which can give scope to your abilities―give play to your abilities―call your abilities into play.

content: 2. (=動詞を活用する)to conjugate (a verb)

はたらき〔働き〕
〈名〉
1. (=労働)work; labour

content.content: 男子一人前の働きをする
to do a man's work―fill a man's shoes
彼は飯を食うだけの働きが無い(穀つぶしだ)
He is not worth his salt.
飯を食うだけの働きがある(穀つぶしでない)
He is worth his salt―earning his salary.
働き甲斐が無かった
I laboured in vain.

content: 2. (=伎倆、腕前)ability; talent

content.content: あれは働きのある人だ
He is an able man―a talented man―a man of talent.
働きの無い人間だ
He is a good-for-nothing―a ne'er-do-well.
貧乏でも働きさえあれば娘をくれてやる
He shall have my daughter if he has talents and abilities, though he may be poor.
後は自分の働きで買うがよい
Your own ability will procure you the rest.

content: 3. (=尽力、功労)exertions; merits; services

content.content: 店は番頭の働きで滅亡を免れた
The house escaped ruin through the exertions of the manager.
彼は自分の働きで出世したのだ
He has risen by his own merit.
報酬は働き次第
Your reward will depend on your services.
彼はたいそう働きぶりをする
He exaggerates his own services.

content: 4. (=作用)action (of the or water); activity (of the mind); agency (of nature); function (of an organ); operation (of a system); working (of a machine); motion (of the parts of a machine); play (of fancy, etc.)

content.content: 頭脳の働き
the working of the head
心臓の働き
the heart's action
胃のたはらき
the functions of the stomach

content: 5. (=動詞の活用)conjugation (of a verb)

はたらきぐち〔働き口〕
〈名〉A position; a situation; a place; a berth; an opening

content.content: 彼は働き口を探している
He seeks for employment―He is looking out for a job.
働き口にありついた
He has found an opening.
働き口をこしらえる
to secure a situation

はたらきばち〔働き蜂〕
〈名〉The worker

content:
はたらきぶり〔働き振り〕
〈名〉
1. (=任を果たすこと)discharge of duty

content.content: 彼はあっぱれな働きぶりだ
He has acquitted himself to his credit.

content: 2. (=功労)services

content.content: 彼はたいそう働きぶりをする
He exaggerates his own services.

はたらきもの〔働き者〕
〈名〉
1. (=勉強家)a hard-working man; a hard-worker
2. (=敏腕家)an able man; a talented man; a man of talent:(古語にては)a man of parts

content:
はたらく〔働く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=労働する)to work; to labour; to toil; to moil; to drudge; to fag; to slave

content.content: 職人が働いている
The workmen are (working―と言わずして)at work.
彼らは朝から晩まで働く
They work from morning till night―work from dawn till dusk.
彼は昼夜を分かたず働く、夜を日に継いで働く
He works night and day.
昼夜兼行で働く
He works double tides―works double hours.
昼寝て夜働く者がある
Some people sleep by day and work by night.
精いっぱい働く
He works with all his might.
一所懸命働く
He works with might and main.
骨身を惜しまず働く
He is not sparing of himself.
なかなか働く、よく働く
He has a capacity for work.
ドシドシ働く
He works like steam―works like anything.
セッセと働け
Work away!
彼らは必死と働く
They work for their lives―work for dear life.
力を入れて働く
They bend to their work―lie down to their work.
彼は忠実に(まめに)働く
He works like a horse―works like a nigger.
殊勝らしく働く、かいがいしく働く
He works like a good one―works like a brick.
汗水流して働く甲斐も無く
He toils and moils in vain.
コツコツ働く、真黒くなって働く
He hammers away at his work―pegs away at his work―plods away at his work―grubs away at his work.
身を粉にして働く
He fags himself to death―drudges himself to death―slaves himself to death.
肌脱ぎになって働く
He works stript to the waist.
熱心に働く
He works with a will―He puts his heart into his work.
あくせく働く
He drudges it―fags it―slaves it.
あくせく働く人だ
He is a drudge―a hack―a hackney.
死ぬまだ働く
to die in harness
適度に働く
to work in moderation
彼は薄給を貰って働いている
He works for a mere pittance.
公益のために働く
to labour for the public good
僕は義務として働く
I work as a matter of duty.
必要に迫って働く
to work under the pressure of necessity
必要に迫らなければ働かぬ
They do not work unless they are pressed by necessity.
以前に倍して働く
to redouble one's efforts
働いた甲斐が無かった
I laboured in vain.
働いた甲斐があった
My labours are crowned with success.
僕は働くには朝が好い
I do my best work in the morning.
働いて銭を取る
to work for money―earn money―turn an honest penny
働いて飯を食う
to work for one's living―work for one's bread―earn one's bread
働いて飯を食うのを恥じることはない
One need not be ashamed of working for one's bread―It is honourable to work for one's brad.
働かないで飯が食えるようになる
to be raised about the necessity of labour
彼は働かないでも飯が食える
He is above the necessity of working.
彼は金があるから働かないでも飯が食える
His wealth raises him above the necessity of labour.
彼は働くのが道楽だ
He loves labour for its own sake―labours for labour's sake.
働く味を知らぬ者は遊び味を知らぬ
He who knows not what it is to labour, knows not what it is to enjoy.
働いて疲れる
to work oneself weary
働いて腹をへらす
to work oneself hungry
あまり働いて病気になる
to work oneself ill
君は若いから働ける
You are young, so you can work―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your youth enables you to work.
彼は年をとって働けぬ
He is old, so he can not work―He is too old to work―He is past work―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His old age disables him from working―prevents him from working.
日本人はとかく働き過ぎる
Japanese are apt to work too hard―overwork themselves.
部下の者がよく働いてくれる、働いてくれぬ
I am well served―ill served.

content: 2. (=どんな働きぶりをする)to behave (how?); to act (how?)

content.content: 兵は弾丸の雨下する下に立ってあたかも演習におけるが如く冷静沈着に働いた
The men behaved under fire as coolly as if they were on parade.
勝手に働け
Act as you thing fit―Act at your discretion.

content: 3. (=商人が安く売る)to sell cheap; to reduce the price

content.content: なるべく働きますからどうぞお買いなすって
We will try to sell as cheap as we can, so you will give us your custom.

content:
4. (=動詞が活用される)(a verb) is conjugated
〈他動〉
1. (=行う)to do (evil); to act (the coward); to commit (a crime); to perpetrate (a crime); to practise (fraud, etc.)

content.content: 悪事を働く
to do evil―commit a crime―perpetrate a crime
彼は悪事を働いて牢へ入ったことがある
He was once caught tripping, and deservedly dealt with.
不正を働く
to do something dishonest―practise fraud
不埒を働く
to do wrong
強盗を働く
to commit robbery
窃盗を働く
to commit theft
乱暴を働く
to do an act of violence―commit an outrage
ひきょうを働く
to act the coward―shirk one's duty―desert one's post
ひきょうを働くな
Do not desert your post!―Do not give up your ship!
晴の場でひきょうは働けぬ
One can not act the coward before a cloud of witnesses.
二人は不義を働いて暇を出された
They were dismissed for having an improper connection.

content: 2. (=作用がある)(acids) act upon (metals); (a book) works upon (one's mind); (medicine) operates upon (the affected part)

content:
ばたりと〔バタリと〕
〈副〉Suddenly

He fell down suddenly, never to rise again.

content:

〈名〉Rupture breaking off (negotiations)

content.content: 破談にする
to break off negotiations
せっかくまとまりかけた相談が破談になった
The negotiation have been broken off after very nearly coming to an understanding.
婚約は破談になった

縁談を破談にした
We have broken off the match.
契約を破談にした
We have annulled the contract―The bargain is off.

content:
バタン
〈擬音詞〉

content.content: 戸をバタンと締める

to bang about the furniture

はち〔八〕
〈名、形〉Eight

content.content: 第八
the eighth
八番目
the eighth―No.8 (number eight)
八の字
the Chinese character for eight
額に八の字寄せる

腹八分目は医者要らず
Moderate eating keeps the doctor away―Temperance is better than medicine.

content:

〈名〉A bowl (for food); a tub (for boiled rice); a basin (for water); a pot (for flowers); a flower-pot

content.content: 鉢に盛る

鉢に植える
to pot a flower
鉢植えの花
a potted flower
手水鉢で顔を洗う

スープ鉢

頭の鉢

お鉢がまわって来た
My turn has come―It is my turn.

content:
はち〔蜂〕
〈名〉(蜜蜂)the bee:(黄蜂)the wasp; the hornet

content.content: 蜂にとげがある
The bee has a sting.
蜂は刺す
A bee stings.
蜂に刺されたことがあるか
Have you ever been stung by a bee?
泣き面に蜂
“Out of the frying-pan into the fire”―“Misfortunes never come singly.”
泣き面に蜂で病人までもできた
To make matters worse, one of us fell ill.
虻蜂取らず
to fall between two stools―(一文とすれば)―“Between two stools, one falls to the ground”
蜂の巣
a hive―a bee-hive―a wasp's nest
船体には蜂の巣のように弾痕があった
The hull was riddled with shot.
蜂蜜
honey

content:
ばち〔罰〕
〈名〉Divine judgement; Heaven's punishment; Heaven's vengeance; retribution

content.content: 罰が当たる
to be punished by Heaven―bring down divine judgment on one's head―draw down Heaven's vengeance on oneself
そんなことをすると罰が当たるぞ
If you do such a thing, Heaven will punish you for it―It is a profanation―a sacrilege―to do such a thing.
そんなことを言うと罰が当たるぞ
It is a profanity―a blasphemy―to say such a thing.
罰が当たったから見ろ
You are punished―You richly deserve it―Serve you right!
貴様は親父に苦労をかけたから罰が当たったのだ
That is a punishment for―a judgment (on you)for―bringing your father's gray hairs to the grave.
こりゃこれまで怠けた罰だ
I must pay dearly for my past idleness.
あまりうまくて罰が当たりそうだ
It is as good as sinning―like sinning.
たまには来てくれても罰も当たるまい
You might come to see me once in a while.

content:
ばち〔撥〕

content.content: 太鼓もばちの当りよう
“Laugh, and the world will laugh with you.”

content:

content.content: この罰当たりめ

content:

content.content: これはお初にお目にかかります
I am glad to meet you―pleased to know you―delighted to make your acquaintance―(通例は)―How do you do?
初物
the first-fruits of the season―the firstlings of the season

the first sunrise of the year

a firstling

the first ears of rice

初ガツオ

content:

content.content: 弾薬十発
ten rounds of ammunition

(小銃を)幾発撃っても一発も命中しなかった

content:
はつ〔髪〕
〈名〉A hair

content.content: 間髪をいれず
It is instantaneous.
その危険間髪をいれず
The bullet missed me by a hair's breadth―missed me by the skin of my teeth―I had a hairbreadth escape―a narrow escape―It was a close shave―a near touch.

content:
ばつ〔罰〕
〈名〉Punishment

content.content: 罰を受ける、罰喰らう
to be punished―get punished―suffer punishment―be subjected to punishment
校則を破って罰喰らった
I was punished for breaking the school regulations.
(そんなことをすると)罰喰らうぞ
You'll catch it.
罰を喰らわしてやる
I'll give it him.
犯人に罰を加える
to visit an offender with punishment―inflict a punishment on the culprit―punish the offender
甘んじて罰を受ける
to submit to punishment―“kiss the rod”
罰を免れる
to escape punishment―elude punishment

content:
ばつ〔閥〕
〈名〉Clanship; partisanship; exclusivism; sectarianism

content.content: 閥を作る
to form a sect―form a clique

content:
ばつ〔跋〕
〈名〉An epilogue
〈以下熟語〉

content.content: 人にバツを合わせる
to keep one in countenance
君がそうだと言うからバツを合わしただけさ
I only said so to keep you in countenance.
ちょいとうそをついてバツを合わせた
I told a fib to keep myself in countenance.
何とかバツを合わしておこう
I will find some excuse.
バツが悪かった
I was put out of countenance―embarrassed―confused.
あまり顔を見られてバツが悪かった
I was stared out of countenance.
そう問われた時はバツが悪かった
I was embarrassed by the question―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The question embarrassed me.

はつあん〔発案〕
〈名〉A suggestion:(=する) to make a suggestion; to suggest (a plan, etc.)

content:
はついく〔発育〕
〈名〉Growth; development:(=する) to grow; to develop

content.content: 卵が発育して雛になる
An egg develops into a chicken.
この子どもは発育が好い、発育が悪い
The child is well grown―undergrown.
発育を妨げる
to check the growth
発育盛りの動物
a growing animal

はつうり〔初売り〕
〈名〉(=商品の初売り)The first sale; a handsel; a hansel

はつえんしょうさん〔発煙硝酸〕
〈名〉Fuming nitric acid

はつえんぜつ〔初演説〕
〈名〉One's maiden speech

はつえんりゅうさん〔発煙硫酸〕
〈名〉Fuming sulphuric acid

content:
はつおん〔発音〕
〈名〉Pronunciation; enunciation; articulation:(=する) to pronounce, enunciate, articulate (words)

content.content: はっきり発音する
to pronounce distinctly
この語はどう発音するか
How do you pronounce this word?―How is this word pronounced?
発音を誤る
to mispronounce a word
あの先生は発音が明皙だ
His pronunciation is clear and distinct.
発音が不明だ
His pronunciation is indistinct.

はつおんがく〔発音学〕
〈名〉Phonetics

はつおんふ〔発音符〕
〈名〉Phonetic signs; diacritical marks

はつおんほう〔発音法〕
〈名〉Elocution

はっか〔白禍〕
〈名〉The White Peril

content:

content.content: ハッカ油
mint-oil
ハッカ・パイプ
a peppermint pipe

content:
はっか〔発火〕
〈名〉Ignition:(=する) to ignite; to be ignited; to flash; to catch fire

content.content: 火薬が発火する
Powder flashes.
銃が発火せぬ
A gun misses fire.
発火点
the flashing-point

はつか〔二十日〕
〈名〉Twenty days:(何月二十日)the twentieth (of January, etc.)

はつが〔発芽〕
〈名〉Germination:(=する) to germinate; to sprout; to bud

content:
ばっか〔幕下〕
〈名〉
1. (=将軍の配下) a vassal, a feudatory (to the Shogun)
2. (=大将の旗下)the chief's banner

content.content: 頼朝が旗を揚げると源氏の残党がその幕下にはせ参じた
When Yoritomo raised his standard, the remnants of the Genji forces flocked to his banner.

content:
はっかいしき〔発会式〕
〈名〉The opening ceremony; the inauguration (of a society)

content.content: 発会式を行う
to hold an inauguration

はっかえんしゅう〔発火練習〕
〈名〉Firing practice; a sham fight

はっかく〔八角〕
〈名〉An octagon:(=の) octagonal

content:
はっかく〔発覚〕
〈名〉Discovery; detection; revelation:(=する) to be discovered; to be detected; to be revealed; to be fount out; to come to light; to be brought to light

content.content: 会社の乱脈が発覚した
The confusion of the company's affairs has been discovered.
調査の結果新事実が発覚した
On enquiry, some new facts have come to light―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Enquiry has brought some new facts to light―Enquiry has revealed some new facts.

content:
はっかける〔吐かける〕

content.content: はきかける〔吐きかける〕

content:
はっかじゅつ〔撥窩術〕
〈名〉［医学］Couching (a cataract)

content.content: 撥窩術を施す
to couch a person or his eye for cataract

content:
はつがつお〔初鰹〕
〈名〉The first bonito of the season

content.content: 褌{ふんどし}を質に置いても初鰹
The Edokko will go any length for the first bonito of the season.

はっかてん〔発火点〕
〈名〉The flashing-point

はつかねずみ〔二十日鼠〕
〈名〉The mouse (複数―mice)

content:
ばっかり
〈副〉→『

content.content: ばかり〔計り〕

content:
はっかん〔発刊〕
〈名〉Publication; issue:(=する) to publish (a journal); to issue (a newspaper); to start (a magazine); to bring out (a newspaper) for the first time

content.content: この雑誌は毎月発刊になる
The magazine is published monthly―comes out every month.
毎週発刊
weekly publication
毎月曜発刊
published every Monday
発刊を祝す
With best wishes for the new-born magazine.

content:
はっかん〔発汗〕
〈名〉Sudation; perspiration; sweat:(=する) to perspire; to sweat

content.content: 発汗している
One is in a perspiration―in a sweat.
発汗を起こす
to break out into a perspiration
発汗すると熱が冷める
A sweat will bring down the fever.
発汗すると治る
A sweat will set you up.
発汗剤
a sudatory―a sudorific
発汗浴
a sudatorium―a sudatory

content:
はっき〔白旗〕
〈名〉A white flag; the flag of truce

content.content: 白旗を掲げる
to show a white flag―display the flag of truce
その船は白旗を掲げておった
The ship was flying the flag of truce.

content:
はっき〔発揮〕
〈名〉Exhibition:(=する) to exhibit; to display; to develop; to give play to, give scope to, give swing to (one's genius, etc.)

content.content: 国体の精華を発揮する
to exhibit the nationality in all its beauty
天才を発揮する
to exhibit one's genius―give play to one's genius―give swing to one's genius
天才を自由に発揮せしむべし
Let your genius have its swing―have free swing―have free play.
天才を遺憾無く発揮している
His genius has full swing.
天才を充分に発揮し得る専門を選ぶべし
You should choose a profession which will give free play to―give ample scope to―give full swing to―your genius.
才能を発揮する
to display one's talents―develop one's powers―give scope to one's abilities
才能を発揮し得る事業をせよ
Engage in some work which will give scope to your abilities―give play to your abilities―call your powers into play.
己が能を発揮するは己に対する義務
Each man owes it to himself to be true to himself―to be true to the best that is in him―to do himself justice.
彼は内気で自分の能を発揮し得ない
He stands in his own light through timidity.
その言はよく彼の人格を発揮している(彼の言いそうなことだ)
The remark is characteristic of the man―It is just like him to say so.
言葉の意味を十分に発揮する
to bring out the full meaning of the word
彼は商人根性を遺憾無く発揮している
He displays his sordid spirit in all its naked glory.
成金ぶりを遺憾無く発揮している
He plays the parvenu to the full.
茶目を発揮する
to play the imp―play pranks

content:
はつぎ〔発議〕
〈名〉A proposition; a suggestion:(=する) to propose; to suggest

content.content: 今夜は飲み明かそうじゃないかと発議した者があった
“Let us make a night of it,” said some one―Some one proposed that they should make a night of it.
発議を出す
to lay a proposition before the meeting
誰の発議により
On whose proposition?―On whose suggestion?
発議者
the proposer
(新法律などの)発議権
the initiative

content:
はっきゅう〔薄給〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: はくきゅう〔薄給〕

content:
はっきょう〔発狂〕
〈名〉Madness; insanity; lunacy; mental alienation; mental derangement:(=せる) mad; insane; lunatic; crazy; demented; bereft of reason:(=する) to go mad; to go crazy; to become insane; to be bereft of reason; to lose one's wits; to go off one's head; to go out of mind; to go out of one's senses; to lose one's senses; to lose one's faculties

content.content: 彼は発狂したのじゃないか
Hasn't he gone mad?―lost his wits?
(あまり挙動が変だから)発狂でもしはせぬかと思った
I feared for his reason.
彼は発狂でもするかと思うほどくやしがった
He nearly went mad with vexation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Vexation nearly drove him mad.
発狂させる
to drive one mad―drive one distracted―drive one to distraction
彼は失敗して発狂した
His failure drove him mad.
彼は発狂でもしたような振舞だ
He behaves like one possessed.
彼の熱心は発狂に近い
His zeal verges on madness.

はっきょうしゃ〔発狂者〕
〈名〉A madman; a lunatic; a bedlamite

content:
ハッキリ
〈副〉
1. (=明瞭に)clearly; distinctly; definitely:(=した) clear; distinct; sharply defined:(=する) to be clear; to be distinct; to be sharply defined

content.content: ハッキリ見える
I can see it clearly―It is clearly visible.
ハッキリ見えない
I can not see it clearly―It is dim―dimly visible.
ハッキリ聞こえる
I can hear it distinctly―It is distinctly audible.
ハッリキ聞こえない
I can not hear it distinctly―It is faint―faintly audible.
ハッキリわかった
I see clearly―understand perfectly well.
ハッキリわからぬ
I don't see clearly―do not understand quite well.
ハッキリ発音する
to pronounce distinctly
ハッキリした発音
a distinct pronunciation―a clear pronunciation
発音がハッキリしない
His pronunciation is not clear―indistinct―thick―muddy.
あの人の頭がハッキリしている、ハッキリしない
He has a clear head―a dull head.
話がハッキリしている、ハッキリしない
He has clear ideas―confused ideas.
声がハッキリしている、ハッキリしない
He has a clear voice―a thick voice.
ハッキリした写真、ハッキリしない写真
a clear photograph―a dim photograph
ハッキリした区別がある
There is a clear distinction―a sharp distinction.
輪郭がハッキリしている
The outline is sharply defined.
ハッキリした輪郭
a clear outline―a sharp outline

content: 2. (=明確に)definitely; exactly; certainly:(=した) definite; exact; certain

content.content: ハッキリ言う
to speak definitely
ハッキリ言えぬ
I can not speak definitely―say for certain.
彼は来るか来ないかハッキリ言わなっかた
He did not say definitely whether he was coming or not.
いつ来るもとハッキリ言わなかった
He did not say exactly when he was coming―He did not mention the exact time of his coming.
ハッキリした返事ができません
I can not give you a definite answer.
ハッキリ存じません、ハッキリわかりません
I don't know for certain―I can't say for certain.
時をハッキリ決める
to fix upon the exact time
(言を左右に託さないで)ハッキリ返事をしろ
Answer me straight!―Give me a direct yes or no!
天気がハッキリしない
The weather is unsettled.
ハッキリしない人だ
He is an irresolute man―He does not know his own mind.
病気がハッキリする
to get well―get better
病気がハッキリしません
The invalid shows no sign of convalescence.

content:
はっきん〔白金〕
〈名〉Platinum

content.content: 白金線
a platinum wire
白金写真版
platinotype

content:
ばっきん〔罰金〕
〈名〉
1. (=刑罰の罰金)a fine; a mulct; a monetary penalty

content.content: 罰金に処す
to punish one with a fine―impose a fine upon one―fine one―mulct one
罰金に処せらる
to be punished with a fine―be sentenced to pay a fine―be fined
五十円の罰金に処せられた
He was fined 50 yen.
この規則を犯す者は五十円の罰金に処す
The violation of this rule is punished with a fine of 50 yen.
罰金を取られる
to be fined―pay a fine
罰金ですんだ
I got off with a fine―I was let off with a fine.
罰金を出さずにすんだ
I was let off without a fine.

content: 2. (=違約などの罰金)a forfeit; a penalty

content.content: 違約したから罰金出せ
You must pay a forfeit for breaking your promise.
違約した罰金として百円取られた
I had to pay 100 yen as a penalty for breach of contract.

はっくつ〔発掘〕
〈名〉Excavation; exhumation; disinterment:(=する) to dig (gold out of the bowels of the earth); to excavate (a buried city); to exhume, disinter (a buried body); to unearth (buried treasure)

はっくぶどおり〔八九分通り〕
〈副〉Very nearly, almost, all but (finished, etc.)

content:
ばっくん〔抜群〕
〈形〉→『

content:
ばつぐん〔抜群〕
〈形〉Distinguished, conspicuous (services); eminent, preeminent (merit); exalted (talent, etc.)

content.content: 抜群の功をたてる
to render distinguished services―conspicuous services
戦争で抜群の功を立てた
He distinguished himself in the war.
抜群の功ある人だ
He is a man of eminent merits―of preeminent merits.
抜群の才を有す
He is endowed with exalted talents.

content:
はっけ〔八卦〕
〈名〉Divination; fortune-telling

content.content: 八卦を置く
to divine―cast a horoscope―cast a nativity―tell fortunes
八卦が当たった
The divination has come true.
当たるも八卦当たらぬも八卦
A divination may or may not come true―There is no saying how a divination may turn out.

はっけい〔八景〕
〈名〉The eight views (of Omi)

はっけっきゅう〔白血球〕
〈名〉A white blood-corpuscle; a leucocyte

content:
はっけん〔発見〕
〈名〉Discovery; detection:(=する) to discover (a fact); to detect (a crime); to find, find out (anything); to light upon, chance upon, happen upon, stumble upon, come upon (a fact by chance); to come across (a genuine article, etc.)

content.content: 僕は発見したことがある
I have made a discovery.
アメリカの発見
the discovery of America
アメリカは一千四百九十二年に発見された
America was discovered in 1492.
この事実は偶然発見した
I lighted upon this fact by chance.
発見はたいがい偶然なものだ
Most discoveries are made by accident.
死体を発見する
to recover a body

はつげん〔発現〕
〈名〉Revelation:(=する) to reveal; to be revealed

content:
はつげん〔発言〕
〈名〉Utterance:(=する) to utter; to speak:(議員なら) to take the floor

content.content: 発言を禁ずる
to forbid one to speak―rule one out of order

content:
ばっけん〔抜剣〕
〈名〉A drawn sword:(=する) to draw one's sword

content.content: 巡査が抜剣で踏み込んだ
A policeman dashed in, sword in hand.

content:
はつげんけん〔発言権〕
〈名〉A voice

content.content: 僕はこの問題については発言権が無い
I have no voice in the matter.
(議員が)発言権を得る
to obtain the floor―get the floor―have the floor
日本は万国会議に発言権を得た
Japan can make herself heard in the council of nations.

はっけんしゃ〔発見者〕
〈名〉The discoverer (of America, etc.)

はつげんしゃ〔発言者〕
〈名〉The speaker

はつこ〔初子〕
〈名〉One's first child; a firstling

content:
ばっこ〔跋扈〕
〈名〉Rampancy; arrogance; domination:(=する) to be rampant; to be arrogant; to dominate over, domineer over, lord it over (the people); to carry matters with a high hand; to have everything one's own way

content.content: 昔は異人が跋扈したものだ
The foreigners used to domineer over the Japanese―lord it over the Japanese―carry matters with a high hand.
異人の跋扈
the rampancy of foreigners―the arrogance of foreigners
ドイツの跋扈を憤慨せぬ者は無かった
All the world was indignant at the rampancy of Germany.
一時は戦争成金が跋扈した
The war-upstarts had everything their own way for a time.
世間では成金どもの跋扈を許さなかった
The public would not tolerate the domination of the upstarts.
あの家では女どもが跋扈している
The woman folk carry matters with a high hand―have everything their own way―in that family.

はつこい〔初恋〕
〈名〉One's first love

はっこう〔白光〕
〈名〉(=太陽の白光)A corona

content:
はっこう〔発光〕
〈名〉Radiation:(=する) to radiate light; to emit light

content.content: 発光体
a luminous body―a luminary

content:
はっこう〔発航〕
〈名〉Departure:(=する) to depart on a voyage; to sail; to set sail

content.content: 米国に向かって発航する
to sail for America

content:
はっこう〔発行〕
〈名〉
1. (=書籍や新聞の発行)publication (of a book); issue (of a newspaper):(=する) to publish, bring out (a book); to issue (a newspaper)

content.content: 本が発行になる
A book is published―comes out.
新聞を発行する
to issue a newspaper―publish a paper
新聞の発行高
the circulation of a newspaper
あの新聞発行高が多い(よく売れる)
The paper enjoys a large circulation.
一月一日の発行部数
the issue of the Times for Jan. 1
発行禁止
prohibition of publication―suppression of issue
新聞の発行を禁止する
to prohibit the publication of a newspaper―suppress a newspaper―place a paper under the ban
あの新聞は発行禁止になった
The paper has been suppressed―placed under the ban.
発行停止
suspension of publication―suspension of issue
新聞の発行を停止する
to suspend the publication of a newspaper
あの新聞は発行停止になった
The paper has been suspended―suspended publication.
発行人
the publisher
発行所
the publishing house―the publishing office

content: 2. (=紙幣や貨幣の発行)issue (of paper money); circulation (of a currency); floatation (of a loan):(=する) to issue (paper money); to circulate (a currency); to raise, float (a loan)

content.content: 紙幣を発行する
to issue paper money
一月の紙幣の発行高
the issue of bank-notes for January
紙幣発行高限度
the maximum issue of bank-notes
紙幣発行過剰
over-issue of bank-notes
発行余力
a margin of note-issuing power
新貨幣を発行する
to circulate a new currency―put a new currency in circulation
債券を発行する
to raise a loan―float a loan

content:
はっこう〔醗酵〕
〈名〉Fermentation:(=する) to ferment

content.content: パンを醗酵させる
to leaven bread―raise bread
醗酵素
yeast
醗酵母
a ferment
醗酵菌
the ferment fungus
社会思想の醗酵
storm and stress

content:
はっこうきんし〔発行禁止〕
〈名〉Prohibition of publication; suppression of issue:(=する) to prohibit the publication of (a newspaper); to suppress (a newspaper or a book); to place (a newspaper) under the ban

content.content: あの新聞は発行禁止になった
The paper has been suppressed―placed under the ban.

はっこうじょ〔発行所〕
〈名〉The publishing house; the publishing office

はっこうたい〔発光体〕
〈名〉A luminous body; a luminary

はっこうだか〔発行高〕
〈名〉Circulation (of a newspaper); issue (of paper money)

content:
はっこうていし〔発行停止〕
〈名〉Suspension of publication; suspension:(=する) to suspend the publication of (a newspaper)

content.content: あの新聞は発行禁止になった
The paper has been suspended―suspended publication―placed under the ban.

はっこうにん〔発行人〕
〈名〉The publisher (of a book or a newspaper)

はつこかうい〔初航海〕
〈名〉(A ship's) maiden trip

content:
はっこつ〔白骨〕
〈名〉White bones; bleached bones

content.content: 朝には紅顔の美少年夕には白骨となる
A rosy-faced youth in the moring, crumbling bones in the evening―“Red at morn, dead at even.”

ばっさいする〔伐採する〕
〈他動〉To cut down, fell (trees)

はっさく〔八朔〕
〈名〉The First Day of the Eighth Month (of the Lunar Calendar)

はっさん〔八散〕
〈名〉Radiation:(=する) to radiate (light or heat)

content:
はっさん〔発散〕
〈名〉Diffusion; emission; radiation:(=する) to diffuse (fragrance); to emit (light or heat); to radiate (light or heat); to breathe (fragrance); give out (fragrance); to send forth (fragrance)

content.content: 香気を発散する
to diffuse a perfume―breathe fragrance―give out fragrance―send forth fragrance―shed a perfume around
光や熱を発散する
to emit light or heat―radiate light or heat

はつざん〔初産〕
〈名〉(A woman's) first childbirth
ばつざんがいせのゆう

ばつざんがいせのゆう〔抜山蓋世の勇〕
〈名〉Mountain-hurling power and world-compelling valour; the valour of a demigod; superhuman valour

ばっし〔末子〕
〈名〉One's youngest child; the last of a family

content:
はっしと〔発止と〕
〈副〉With a clash

content.content: 打込んで来る太刀を発止と受け止めた
I caught the blow with a clash.

はつしも〔初霜〕
〈名〉The first frost of the year

content:
はっしゃ〔発射〕

八方美人は薄情
Everybody's friend is nobody's friend.

content:
はっぽうふさがり〔八方塞がり〕
〈名〉Having no lucky quarter

content.content: 今年は八方ふさがりだ
I have no lucky quarter this year.
日本は八方ふさがりの姿だ
Japan is handicapped on every side―She has the world against her.

ばつぼく〔伐木〕
〈名〉Felling trees:(=する) to fell trees; to cut down trees

content:
はつみみ〔初耳〕
〈名〉Hearing for the first time

content.content: そりゃ初耳だ
That's new to me―news to me.

content:
はつめい〔発明〕
〈名〉Invention:(=する) to invent, devise (a machine, etc.)

content.content: 十九世紀は発明に富んだ
The Nineteenth Century was fruitful in inventions.
彼は発明の才がある
He has inventive genius―a genius for invention―He is of an inventive turn of mind.
蒸気機関は Watt の発明にかかる
The steam engine was invented by James Watt.
電話は誰の発明か
Who invented the telephone?―By whom was the telephone invented?―Who is the inventor of the telephone?
火薬は支那人の発明だと言う
The invention of gunpowder is attributed to the Chinese―The Chinese are credited with the invention of gunpowder.
新発明
a new invention

content: 〈形〉(=利口発明)sagacious

はつめいか〔発明家〕
〈名〉An inventor

はつめいしゃ〔発明者〕
〈名〉The inventor (of something)

content:
