〈名〉The first-fruits of the season; the firstlings of the season

content.content: 初物を食うと七十五日生き延びる
The enjoyment of first-fruits will add seventy-five days to one's natural term of existence.
終り初物
the last fruit of the season

はつやく〔初役〕
〈名〉(An actor's) appearance in a new character

はつゆき〔初雪〕
〈名〉The first snowfall of the season

はつゆめ〔初夢〕
〈名〉The first dream of the New Year

content:
はつよう〔発揚〕
〈名〉Enhancement:(=する) to enhance

content.content: 国威を発揚する
to enhance the glory of the nation

content:
はつらつ〔溌剌〕
〈形〉Lively; fresh

content.content: 元気はつらつ
He is in exuberant spirits.
元気はつらつたる青年
a lively youth
才気はつらつ
He has sprightly powers.

はつれん〔発輦〕
〈名〉The Emperor's departure

content:
ハテ
〈間投詞〉I wonder

content.content: ハテ何だろう
I wonder what it is.
ハテどうしたものだろう
I wonder what I shall do.
ハテ変だ
Strange!―How very odd!
その人の様子がハテ変だなと思った
His appearance struck me as strange.
ハテ不思議だ
Wonderful!―Prodigious!
ハテ不思議だと思った
It struck me as wonderful.

content:
はて〔果〕
〈名〉
1. (=末端)the end (of the earth); the extremity (of the sea); the termination (of a life, etc.)

content.content: 世界の果て
the world's end―the ends of the earth―the confines of the earth―the four corners of the earth
お前とならば世界の果てまでも
I would go to the ends of the earth in your company.
世界の果てまで行ってもこの恨みを晴らさずにはおかぬ
I would go to the world's end, but I will be revenged.
果てから果てまで
from end to end
彼は日本国中果てから果てまで歩いている
He has travelled over the country from end to end―travelled throughout the land―travelled over the length and breadth of the country.
果ての無い林
an endless forest―an interminable forest

content: 2. (=終結)the end (of a matter); the fate (of an evil-door); the consequences (of one's conduct); the final scene (of a life-drama); the upshot (of a matter)

content.content: 果てはどうなることやら
How will it all end?―There is no saying how it will end.
果ては夜逃げくらいが落ちだろう
The final scene will perhaps end in a moonlight flitting.
(通い詰めた)果ては心中くらいが落ちだろう
The upshot of the matter will be a double suicide.
果ては皆俺の厄介になる
They all come to me in the end.
(始め威張り過ぎた)果てはほうほうの体で逃げ出したいとう始末さ
The end of it was,―The upshot of the matter was,―that I had to beat a precipitate retreat.
冗談の果てはけんか
The joke ended in a quarrel.
放蕩の果てはあんなものだ
Such are the consequences of a riotous life.
栄華の果ては悲惨なものだ
Sad is the final scene of over-prosperity.
悪事を為す者の果てを見ておけ
Look at the fate of an evil-doer!
憂いの果てに沈む
to sink into the depths of misery→『あげくのはてに〔挙句の果てに〕』→『なれのはて〔成れの果〕』

content:
はで〔派手〕
〈形〉Gay (dress); showy (clothes); gaudy (pattern); garish (design); loud (colour); dashing (woman); ostentatious (life, etc.)

content.content: 派手な支度
a gay dress―a showy attire
あの人は派手造りだ
He is showily dressed.
あの婦人は派手造りだ
She dresses gaily.
年の割には派手だ
She dresses too gaily for her years.
この柄は私には派手過ぎる
The pattern is too gaudy for me.
色が派手過ぎる
The colour is too loud.
あの婦人の支度は派手過ぎる
Her dress is too loud.
あの人は派手好きだ
He is found of show―He is fond of display―He likes to cut a dash.
あの婦人は派手好きだ
She is a dashing lady.
細君は派手好きで金さえあれば着物を買ってしまう
His wife is a dashing woman, and spends all her money on finery.
あの人は派手に暮らしている
He lives a gay life―lives in style.
派手に結婚式を挙げた
Their marriage was celebrated with ?clat.
派手に儀式を挙げた
The ceremony was solemnized with ?clat.

ばてい〔馬丁〕
〈名〉A groom:(乗馬や馬車につく馬丁)a footman:(旅館の馬丁)an ostler; a stable-boy

content:
ばてい〔馬蹄〕
〈名〉A horse's hoof

content.content: 馬蹄から火が出る
The hoofs strike fire.

ばていぎん〔馬蹄銀〕
〈名〉(=支那の馬蹄銀)Sycee (silver)

ばていじしゃく〔馬蹄磁石〕
〈名〉A horseshoe magnet

content:
ハテサテ
〈間投詞〉How!

content.content: ハテサテ妙なこともあるものだ
How very odd!
ハテサテ不思議なこともあるものだ
Wonderful!―Prodigious!―It is nothing short of a miracle.
ハテサテ不思議なこともあるものだと思った
It struck me as wonderful.
ハテサテ困ったことができた
I am at my wits' end―in a fix.

content:
はてし〔果てし〕
〈名〉An end; a termination; a conclusion

content.content: その議論は果てしが無い(水掛論)
It is an endless argument.
それは水掛論で果てしがつかぬ
It is an endless argument that leads to no result.
果てしの無き世
a world without end
果てしの無い森林
an interminable forest
果てしのつかぬ軍さ
an interminable war

はてしなき〔果てし無き〕
〈形〉Endless (argument); never-ending (warfare); interminable (forest); boundless (ocean); everlasting (struggle); eternal (world, etc.)

はてしなく〔果てし無く〕
〈名〉Endless; eternally; for ever

はでずき〔派手好き〕
〈形〉Fond of show; fond of display; dashing (woman)

content:
ハテナ
〈間投詞〉Let me see

content.content: ハテナ、今日は何をしたろう
Let me see―what have I done today?

content:
はてる〔果てる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=終る)to end; to terminate; to conclude

content.content: いつ果てることやら
When will it all end?―There is no saying when it will end.
この議論は果てぬ
The argument is interminable―It is an endless argument.

content: 2. (=死ぬ)to meet one's end; to die

content.content: 彼は人手にかかって果てた
He died by the end of his enemy.
(今はぜいたく三昧をして派手に暮らしているが)末はどこのいずくに果てるやら
They will die in a ditch.
河だちは川で果てる
“Good swimmers are oftenest drowned.”

content: 3. (=何々して果てる)to be all (done); to be (done) up

content.content: 疲れ果てた
I am tired out―done up―exhausted.
たまげ果てた
I am all amazement.
彼はやつれ果てた
He is the shadow of his former self.

ばてれん〔伴天連〕
〈名〉A Jesuit missionary of the Sixteenth Century (a corruption of the Portuguese “padren”)

content:
はてんこう〔破天荒〕
〈名〉A new record:(=の) record-breaking (result); unprecedented (success); unparallelled (triumph, etc.)

content.content: 破天荒の大安売
a record-breaking bargain
これは破天荒の快挙である
This is an unprecedented undertaking.

content:
ハート
〈名〉(=トランプのハート)Hearts

content.content: 切札はハート
Hearts are trumps.
ハートの一
the ace of hearts

content:
はと〔鳩〕
〈名〉The pigeon; the dove

content.content: 鳩が鳴く
A dove coos.
蛇の如く賢く鳩の如く温和なれ
“Be ye wise as serpents and harmless as dovers.”
鳩が豆鉄砲を喰らったような顔をしている
He looks like a duck in a thunderstorm.
鳩小舎
a dove-cot―a pigeon-house―a pigeonry

content:
はとう〔波濤〕
〈名〉Waves:(より)seas

content.content: 彼らは万里の波濤を越えて来る
They come from over the seas―Seas roll between this land and the land from whence they come.
生れ故郷を後にして万里の波濤を越えて来る
They leave their beloved homes behind them, and cross the rolling seas.
君は万里の波濤を越えて行く
You are going over the seas―Seas shall roll between you and me.

content:
はどう〔覇道〕
〈名〉The rule of might

content.content: 王道と覇道
right and might

はどう〔波動〕
〈名〉Wave-motion; undulation; fluctuation:(=する) to undulate; to fluctuate

content:
ばとう〔罵倒〕
〈名〉Severe criticism; slashing criticism; scathing criticism; a condemnation; a denunciation; a diatribe; jeers; taunts:(=する) to decry, cry down, run down (what one values); to criticize severely; to condemn, damn (a new work); to denounce (a man or his conduct); to tear, pick, pull (a doctrine) to pieces; to jeer at (a man); taunt (a man)

content.content: お国を罵倒されて黙って聞いておれない
I can't bear to hear my country run down.
反対論をうんと罵倒してやり給え
You ought to tear the opposite views to pieces.
口を極めて人を罵倒する
to denounce a man in every key―in no measured terms
こんな物は駄目だと言って新著述を罵倒した
He condemned the new work―damned the new work.
彼が出ると弥次連が盛んに罵倒を試みた
He was greeted with jeers from the mob.
彼の演説は反対党の罵倒で持ちきっていた
His speech was a diatribe against the opposite party from beginning to end.

はどうせつ〔波動説〕
〈名〉The wave theory, the undulatory theory (of light)

はとごや〔鳩小舎〕
〈名〉A dove-cot; a pigeon-house, a pigeonry

content:
はとば〔波止場〕
〈名〉A wharf; a jetty; a quay

content.content: 波止場へ船をつける
to haul up to the wharf
イギリス波止場
the English wharf
波止場税
wharfage
波止場人足
a 'longshoreman
(物品の)波止場渡し
ex wharf―ex quay

はとむね〔鳩胸〕
〈名〉A pigeon-breast; a chicken-breast:(=の) pigeon-breasted; chicken-breasted

content:
はどめ〔歯止め〕
〈名〉A brake; a drag

content.content: 歯止めをかける
to put on the brake―drag the carriage

content:
はな〔花〕
〈名〉
1. A flower:(木の花)a blossom:(草木ともに)a bloom

content.content: 花が咲く
A flower opens or blooms―A tree blossoms―A plant flowers or comes into flower―A rose blows.
花が咲いた
The flowers are out―The blossoms are out.
煎豆に花が咲く
You might as well expect parched beans to flower.
女やもめに花が咲く
A widow will arouse interest.
また花の咲く時もあろう
I may again be at the top of Fortune's wheel.
話に花が咲く
The talk becomes animated.
花を咲かせる
to make a flower bloom―make a tree blossom―(評判を上げるの意味なら)―make a noise―create a sensation
枯木に花を咲かせる
to make a dead tree blossom
花を咲かせたこともある
I have made a noise in my time.
けんかに花を咲かせた
The quarrel created a sensation at the time.
ひと花咲かせようと思う
I mean to make a noise in the world.
花は半開
Flowers are best when half open.
花は半開、酒はほろ酔い
Moderation is the soul of enjoyment.
花が盛りだ
The flowers are in bloom―The trees are in blossom―The plants are in flower.
花は真盛り
The flowers are in full bloom―The trees are in full blossom―The plants are in full flower―The roses are full-blown.
時に逢わば散るも
Scatter to the mountain gale
目出度し山桜
When please the powers above!
愛づるは花の
For not alone in blossom full
盛りのみかは
Do I thee, Cherry, love.
花が散る
Flowers fall―Blossoms fall.
花が散った
The flowers are over―The blossoms are over.
あたら盛りの花を散らす
She was cut off in the flower of her youth.
あたら蕾の花を散らした
She was cut off in the bud of womanhood.
あたら花を野で暮らす
She wastes her sweetness on the desert air.
花笑い鳥歌う
Flowers smile and birds sing.
花がしぼむ
A flower fades―A flower withers.
花がしおれる
A flower droops.
(朝顔などの)花が化ける
A flower varies―A flower sports.
花を作る
to raise flowers―cultivate flowers
花を生ける
to put flowers in a vase―arrange flowers
床の間に花が生けてある
In the alcove stands a vase of flowers.
花を摘む
to pick flowers―gather flowers
花を手折る(両意義において)
to pluck a flower
花に水をやる
to water the flowers
ひと枝の花
a sprig of blossoms―a spray of blossoms
時ならぬ花
a flower out of season
手の届く花は無い
There are no flowers within my reach.
花はあれども手が届かぬ
The flowers are out of my reach.
花はあれども及びが無い
The flowers are beyond my reach.
かんばせ花の如し
She is as fair as a flower.
花のかんばせ月の眉
a blooming face and crescent brows
窈窕{ようちょう}花の如し
She is as graceful as a flower.
花とも玉とも光る美人
a radiant beauty
花にたわむれる蝶
a butterfly fluttering from flower to flower
蝶よ花よと育てた娘
She was brought up with the tenderest care―“kept as the apple of their eye.”
花多ければ実少し
Good flowers are poor fruiters―Elegance and utility do not go together.
花も実もある
to be both interesting and instructive―both elegant and useful―to unite elegance with utility
隣の花は赤い
“Variety is the mother of enjoyment,”
錦上花を添える
to adorn perfection itself
(葬式に)花を贈る
to present a floral tribute

content: 2. (=桜花)the cherry-blossom

content.content: 花が咲いた
The cherry-trees are in blossom―The cherry-blossoms are out.
花は真盛り
The cherry-trees are in full blossom―We are in the height of the cherry season.
花のトンネルをくぐる
to pass through an avenue of cherry-blossoms
花は見頃だ
The cherry-blossoms are at their best.
花吹いて風雨多し
When the cherry-blossoms are out, so are the storms.
花には嵐
“Roses have thorns.”
花は桜木、人は武士
The cherry among flowers, the samurai among men.
月下花を賞す
to view the cherry-blossoms bathed in moonlight
花が散る
The blossoms fall―The blossoms laugh.
花がちらちら散る
Flower-petals flit in the wind.
もう花は散ったろう
The blossoms must be over.
咲いた桜に
Why tie thy steed
何故駒繋ぐ
To a blossoming cherry-tree?
駒が勇めば
The horse will prance,
花が散る
The blossoms scattered be.
花より団子
Pudding rather than fame.
物いう花
a living flower
社交界の花
a society belle
鄙の花
the pride of the village
手生けの花
a kept mistress
手生けの花にする
to have her to oneself―call her one's own
他に増す花ができたらしい
There is somebody in the wind―Somebody is standing in my shoes.
売物に花を飾る
“No man cries stinking fish.”
花を持たせる
to yield the palm to the leading actor
花の都
the metropolis

content: 4. (=粋)the essence, the flower (of anything)

content.content: 武士道は日本の花
Bushido is the flower of Japan.
一座の花だ
He is the life of the party―the life and soul of the party.
器量は当座の花
“Beauty is a fragile good.”
若いうちが花だ
Youth is the flower of life.
世帯の苦労を知らないうちが花だ
Life is happy when one is still free from household cares.
彼はあの頃は花だった
He was at his best then.
言わぬが花
Better leave it unsaid―“The least said, the soonest mended”―“Silence is golden.”

content: 5. (=生花)flower-arrangement

content.content: 茶や花を習う
to take lessons in tea-ceremony and flower-arrangement

content: 6. (=花札)the flower-cards (the Japanese playing-cards)

content.content: 花を引く
to play (at) cards
花を引いている
They are at cards.
花を引いて夜を明かすことがある
They sometimes play the night away.
あの人は花が上手だ
He is a good card-player.

content: 7. (=祝儀)a gratuity; a tip

content.content: 女中に花をやる
to tip a girl
俳優に花をやる
to make a present of money to an actor
湯の花
hot-spring incrustations

content:
はな〔端〕
〈名〉The beginning; the start; the outset

content.content: はなから
from the outset―from the very outset

content:
はな〔鼻〕
〈名〉
1. The nose, the proboscis (of man); the (sharp) snout, the (blunt) muzzle (of an animal); the trunk, the proboscis (of an elephant)

content.content: 鼻の孔
the nostrils
鼻の障子
the septum
あの人は鼻が高い、鼻が低い
He has a high nose―a flat nose.
鼻の高い人
a man with a high nose
鼻が仰向いている
He has a turned-up nose.
鼻が欠ける
to lose one's nose
彼は瘡で鼻が欠けた
He has lost his nose from syphilis.
鼻をほじる
to pick one's nose
鼻を鳴らす
to snort
鼻をつまむ
to hold one's nose―pinch one's nose―(人の鼻なら)―pull one by the nose
真暗で鼻をつままれるようだ
It is pitch-dark―too dark to see an inch before one.
人と鼻を突き合わす
to be in each other's company
彼とは毎日鼻を突き合わしている
I am daily thrown into his company.
(狭くて)鼻かつかえるようだ
There is not room enough to swing a cat.
鼻の先にある、つい目と鼻の間にある
It is under our nose―under your very nose.
鼻を高くする
to be proud
君は一等賞を取って鼻が高い
You ought to be proud―may well be proud―of winning the first prize.
彼は息子が偉くなったので鼻を高くしている
He is proud of his son.
息子が成功すれば親父は鼻が高い
The son's success reflects credit on his father.
鼻を高くして帰って来た
He returned with conscious pride―with a triumphant look―in triumph.
得意の鼻をうごめかす
to be triumphant―elated with success
人を鼻つまみにする
to hold one in disgust
あの男は鼻つまみにされている
He is held in disgust.
鼻にかける
to pride oneself on―be proud of―anything
好男子を鼻にかけている
He is vain of his good looks.
好い男が鼻にぶら下がっている
He is conscious of his personal advantages.
彼は些細な手柄を鼻にかけて到るところで傍若無人の振舞をする
He makes himself at home everywhere on the strength of a trifling service.
天狗の鼻を折る
to humiliate a proud man―humble his pride―cut his comb
彼の鼻をひしいでやった
I snubbed him.
鼻を明かす
to put one's nose out of joint
人を鼻であしらう
to turn up one's nose at one―sniff at one
彼は人を鼻であしらうふうがある
He has a supercilious air.
鼻で笑う
to sneer at one
木で鼻をくくったような返事をする
to give one a curt answer―give one a short answer―give one a tart rejoinder―give one a snappish answer―snap one's nose off―bite one's nose off―answer snappishly
鼻の下が長い
to be susceptible to female charms
鼻の下を伸ばす
to be spooney on a girl
目から入って鼻へ抜けるよう
He is as sharp as a needle―He has a subtle intellect.
あの人は鼻先思案だ
He can't see beyond his nose.

content: 3. (=嗅ぐ鼻)the nose; scent; the sense of smell

content.content: 鼻が利く
He has a good nose―a good scent.
犬には足の早いのと鼻が利くのとある
Some dogs are chosen for speed, others for scent.
風邪を引いて鼻が利かぬ
I have a cold and no nose.
彼は鼻が鋭い、鼻が敏い
He has a keen nose―a keen sense of smell.
鼻は(使わないと)利かなくなる(ばかになる)
Your nose (if not used) gets out of practice.
匂いが鼻につく
to stink in one's nostrils
船アカの匂いがまだ鼻についている
The bilge-water still stinks in my nostrils―I can not get rid of the smell of bilge-water.
魚と客とは三日目に鼻につく
Fish and guests smell when they are three days old.
あの女房は鼻についているのだ
He is tired of his wife.
臭気芬々{ふんぷん}鼻を突く
A vile smell greets the nose―It stinks―It is offensive to the smell.
臭気芬々鼻をつくような乞食小屋
a stinking hovel―a squalid hovel
この漬物は臭気鼻をつく
These pickles are offensive to the smell.

content: 4. (=呼吸する鼻)the nose

content.content: 鼻で息を吐く
to breathe through the nose
鼻を曲げても息を吐く
to live by hook or by crook
鼻で息を吸う
to sniff―snuff―snuffle
風邪を引いて鼻がつまった
I have a cold in the nose―a cold in the head―My nostrils are clogged.
東北人は言葉が鼻にかかる
The North-Easterners speak through the nose―They have a nasal twang.

content: 5. (=鼻水、洟)nasal mucus; snivel; snot(は尾籠)

content.content: 鼻水が出て困る
I am always running at the nose.
この子は始終鼻水を垂らしている
He is always snivelling―He is constantly running at the nose―His nose is constantly running.
鼻水をすする
to sniff―snuff―snuffle
鼻をかむ
to blow one's nose
ハンケチではなをかむ
to blow one's nose on (or into) a handkerchief

content: 6. (=崎)a land's end; a headland; a promontory; a cape; a point

content.content: 本牧の鼻
Honmoku Point
鼻をまわる
to double a cape

はなあぶら〔鼻油〕
〈名〉The grease on the nose

content:
はなあらし〔鼻嵐〕
〈名〉Snorting

content.content: 馬が鼻嵐を吹く
A horse snorts.

content:
はなあわせ〔花合せ〕
〈名〉Card-playing

content.content: 花合わせをする
to play (at) cards

content:
はないき〔鼻息〕
〈名〉The breath of one's nostrils

content.content: 鼻息が荒い
to be uncompromising
売手は鼻息が荒い
The sellers stand firm―They won't come to terms.
英語教員は払底だから鼻息が荒い
Teachers of English are so scarce that they are unapproachable.
人の鼻息を窺う
to hang on one's smiles―wait on one's beck

はないけ〔花生け〕
〈名〉A flower-vase

content:
はなうた〔鼻歌〕
〈名〉Humming a song

content.content: 鼻歌を歌う
to hum a tune―hum an air
一生鼻歌で暮らす
to hum one's life away―(普通は)―whistle one's life away
鼻歌がけで仕事に取りかかった
I set about my task with a light heart―I made light of my work.

content:
はなうり〔花売り〕
〈名〉A flower-vender

content.content: 花売娘
a flower-girl

はなえんどう〔花豌豆〕
〈名〉The sweet pea

content:
はなお〔鼻緒〕
〈名〉The cords (of a clog)

content.content: 下駄の鼻緒をすげる
to fit a clog with cords
下駄の鼻緒を切らす
to break the cords of one's clogs(considered a bad omen)

はなかけ〔鼻欠け〕
〈名〉A man who has lost his nose

はながさ〔花笠〕
〈名〉A head-gear decorated with artificial flowers (worn at festivals by procession-makers)

content:
はなかぜ〔鼻風〕
〈名〉A cold in the head

content.content: 鼻風を引いた
I have a cold in the head―a cold in the nose.

content:
はながた〔花形〕
〈名〉A star (actor)

content.content: 一座の花形
He is the life of the party―the life and soul of party.
彼は英語の先生の花形だ
He is a star English teacher.

はながたみ〔花筐〕
〈名〉A flower-basket

content:
はなかむ〔鼻かむ〕
〈自動〉To blow one's nose

content.content: ハンケチで鼻かむ
to blow one's nose on (or into) a handkerchief

はながるた〔花歌留多〕
〈名〉The flower-cards (the Japanese playing-cards)

はなかんざし〔花簪〕
〈名〉A flower-hairpin

content:
はなぐすり〔鼻薬〕
〈名〉A bribe; a douceur; a sop to Cerberus

content.content: 鼻薬を使う
to bribe a man―gild his palm―grease his palm
鼻薬が利いた
The bribe has its effect.

はなくそ〔鼻屎〕
〈名〉Dirt in the nose

はなぐもり〔花曇り〕
〈名〉The cloudy weather of the cherry season

content:
はなげ〔鼻毛〕
〈名〉The hair of the nostrils

content.content: 人の鼻毛を抜く
to steal a march upon one
(女が)男の鼻毛を読む
to be fool a man―make a fool of a man
彼は女に鼻毛を読まれた
He was made a fool of.
存分鼻毛を読まれた
She fooled him to the top of his bent.
鼻毛を伸ばしている(鼻毛が長い)
He is infatuated with a woman―spooney on a girl.

content:
はなごえ〔鼻声〕
〈名〉A nasal twang; a snuffling voice

content.content: 鼻声で物を言う
to speak through the nose―have a nasal twang―snuffle―have the snuffles

はなござ〔花蓙〕
〈名〉Flowered matting; fancy matting

はなことば〔花言葉〕
〈名〉The language of flowers

はなごよみ〔花暦〕
〈名〉A floral calendar

content:
はなざかり〔花盛り〕
〈形〉(Flowers are) in bloom, in full bloom; (trees are) in blossom, in full blossom; (plants are) in flower, in full flower

content.content: その時は花盛りであった
The cherry-trees were then in blossom.

content:
はなさき〔鼻先〕
〈副〉Under one's nose

content.content: 鼻先へ白刃を突きつけられた
Cold steel was thrust under my nose.

content:
はなさきしあん〔鼻先思案〕
〈名〉Short-sighted views

content.content: 女は鼻先思案だ
A woman can not see beyond her nose.

はなさく〔花咲く〕
〈自動〉(A plant) flowers; (a tree) blossoms

content:
はなし〔話〕
〈名〉
1. (=談話)(a) talk; a chat; conversation

content.content: 人と話をする
to talk―have a talk―with one―(茶飲み話なら)―chat―have a chat―with one
戦争の話をする
to talk about the war
君とゆっくり話をしてみたい
I wish to have a long talk with you.
このことについては彼と幾度も話をした
I have had many talks with him about the matter.
皆が面白そうに話をしている
They are having a pleasant chat.
時々話しに行く
I often go for a chat with him.
ちと話しに来給え
Come for a chat sometimes!
ちょっとお話ししたいことがある
I wish to have a word with you.
ちょっと内証でお話したい
A word with you (in private)!
話を始める
to enter into conversation
汽車の中で知らない人と話しを始めた
In the train, I entered into conversation with a stranger.
さっきも君の話が出た
We were talking about you just now.
世間ではその話で持切っている
People talk of nothing but that―talk of nothing else.
寄るとさわるとその話だ
They can't meet without talking about that.
彼は話はわかっているがすることは阿呆だ
He talks like a man of sense, but his actions are those of a fool.
積る話をする
to compare notes (with each other)
積る話がしてみたい
I should like to compare notes with him.
彼と話が合う
We get on very well together.
話は合わない
We can't get on together.
たいそう話が持てますね
You are getting on famously together.
話が持てなくなる、話がだれる
The conversation flags.
話に花が咲く、話がはずむ
The talk becomes animated.
話が陰気になる
The talk becomes dismal.
話に実が入る
The talk becomes earnest.
話が理に落ちる
The talk grows serious.
話が前後しました
I have got confused in my talk―got mixed up.
話がちと前後したが要するにこういうことさ
I have got rather mixed up, but in short, what I mean is this.
あの人の話はゴチャゴチャしている
His ideas are confused.
話が下へ下がる
The talk becomes foul―The talk becomes filthy―The conversation degenerates.
話もここまで来ればおしまいだ
When you come to this point, talk is at an end.
話が途切れる
There is a break in the talk―a pause in the talk.
話が絶える
The talk dies.
話が立消えになる
The talk dies a natural death.
話を絶やさぬ
to keep up the talk―keep up the ball―keep the ball rolling―keep the pot boiling
話の腰を折る
to interrupt one in one's talk―interrupt one's talk with a question
音楽の話で思い出したが田中令嬢の歌を聞いたか
Talking of music, have you heard Miss Tanaka sing?
話のついでに君に尋ねたいことがある
While I think of it, I have something to ask you.
話は違うが、今、帝劇で何をやっているかね
By the bye, what are they performing at the Imperial?
猥褻な話
foul talk―filthy talk
辻褄の合わぬ話
incoherent talk
筋違いの話
illogical talk
ありのままの話
the truth―the whole truth
ありのままの話をする
to tell the truth―state a fact as it is
この場限りの話だがあの人の言うことは当てにならぬ
Between ourselves, he is not to be relied upon.
尾籠なお話ですが全くその通りなのです
It is, saving your presence, just as I say.
人に話をしかける
to engage one in conversation
話の種
a topic of conversation
話の種は尽きぬ
Topics of conversation are never wanting.
戦争は好い話の種になる
The war affords a good topic for conversation.
戦争はいつも話の種だ
The war is the staple of conversation.
これは話の種になる
I have added to my stock of knowledge.
今度の旅行には話の種がたくさんある
I have had many adventures on my journey.
こんな汚い小屋にお泊りになるのもお話の種です
To stay for a night in such a squalid hovel, will be an adventure for you.
話の種に一つ見ておこう
I will have a look at it, so that I may be able to say that I have seen it.
話し相手が無い
I have no one to talk to.
話し相手が欲しい
I want some one to talk to.
老人二人は好い話し相手だ
The two old men are cronies.
僕は話し下手だ
I am a poor talker.
話し上手の聴き下手
He is a good talker, but a poor listener.
話し好き
talkative―communicative―loquacious―chatty
老人は話し好きだ
Old folks are garrulous.
(電話)話し中
Engaged!

content: 2. (=言)what one says; one's statement; a remark

content.content: あの人の話はさっぱりわからない
I can make nothing of what he says.
あの人の話は当てにならぬ
His statements are not to be depended upon.
お話の人はどこにいますか
Where is the man you speak of?
これがかねてお話の本ですか
Is this the book you speak of?
君の話は後が悪い
Your remarks have bad conclusions.

content: 3. (=話の種)a topic

content.content: よもやまの話をした
We talked on different topics.
食事中宗教政治に関する話は禁物だ
Religion and politics are forbidden topics at table.
どんな話が学生に人気があるかね
What sort of topics take with the students?

content: 4. (=話の問題)a subject; a question

content.content: 話を転ずる
to change the subject
彼は一笑に付して話を転じた
He lightly dismissed the subject with a laugh.
この話はもう止そう
Let us drop the subject.
その話はもうご免だ
I don't care to hear that subject mentioned.
彼はこの話がでるとご機嫌が悪い
He is sore on the subject.
話の糸口を切る
to broach the subject―break the ice
話に油が乗る
to warm to one's subject
そりゃ別の話だ
That's another question―beside the question―aside from the subject.
そんなことはてんで話にならぬ
That is altogether out of the question.

content: 5. (=噂、評判、風説)what people say; report; a rumour; (a piece of) news

content.content: 世間の話では事態容易ならぬようだ
People say that the matter grows serious.
彼はたいそう金持ちだという話だ
They say that he is very rich―He is said to be very rich.
そりゃ耳寄りの話だ
That's welcome news―a piece of good news.
話が好過ぎる
The news is too good to be true.
根も葉も無い話だ、跡形も無い話だ
The rumour is unfounded―It is a groundless report.

content: 6. (=談判)negotiations

content.content: 話がまだそこまで運んでいない
The negotiations are not yet so far advanced.
話を進めてよろしいか
May I go on with the negotiations?―proceed with the negotiations?
話の糸口を切る
to open negotiations―commence negotiations
話をまとめる
to conclude the negotiations
話がまとまった
The negotiations have come to a conclusion.
話をつける
to arrange the matter―settle the matter
債権者と話をつけた
I have arranged with my creditors―compounded with my creditors.
話がつく
to come to terms―comes to an understanding
なんとか話がつかないか
Can't you come to some understanding?
なんとか話がつくだろう
I hope we shall come to some understanding?
話がついた
We have come to terms―come to an understanding―come to an agreement―closed a bargain―struck a bargain.
二人は話しずくで別れた
They separated by common consent.

content: 7. (=物語り、噺)a story; a tale; a legend; a fable; a narration; an anecdote; a yarn

content.content: お話をする
to tell a story―spin a yarn
暗闇でお話をしておった
We sat telling stories in the dark.
先生、お話をして下さい
Sir, please tell us a story!
何の話をしましょうか
What shall I tell you about?
誰か偉い人のお話を
Tell us about some great man!
僕は話が下手だ
I am a poor story-teller―a poor hand at telling stories―not much of a hand at spinning yarns.
君は話が上手だ
You are a good story-teller―a good hand at telling stories―a capital hand at spinning yarns.
サアお話を聞きましょう
We are ready to hear your story.
今度は君の方の話を聞こう
I will now hear your side of the story.
そりゃ面白い話だ
That is an interesting story―an amusing story.
おかしな話だ
It is a funny story.
際どい話だ
It is a racy story―a spicy story.
為になる話だ
It is an instructive story―(修身としてなら)―an edifying story.
もっともらしい話だ
It is a plausible story.
ばかばかしい話だ
It is an absurd story―a cock-and-bull story.
愚夫愚婦をだます話だ
It is an old wives' tale.
猥褻な話だ
It is an indecent story.
ありふれた話だ
It is the old, old story.
いい加減の作り話だ
It is a made-up story―a trumped-up story―a fabrication―an invention―a make-up.
あの人の話は受取りにくい(話半分に聞け)
His stories must be taken with a grain of salt―His stories must be taken with some (grains of) allowance.
早い話が働かずに金を取ろうとしたのだ
To make a long story short, he tried to obtain money without working for it.
値段がまるで話のようだ
The price is fabulous―It sounds like fiction.
まるで嘘のような話だ
It is an incredible story.
話変わって
Meanwhile,―In the meantime,...

content: 8. (=実見談)an account:(詳しい話)a description:(詳{つまびら}かな話)a recital

content.content: 見て来た話をする
to give an account of what one has seen
戦地から帰った将校が戦争の話をした
An officer returned from the front gave an account of the war.
彼の外国の話を聞いた
I have heard his account of foreign countries.
身の上話をする
to give an account of one's life―tell one's story
彼自身の話によるとずいぶん艱難辛苦を経ているようだ
According to his own account, he seems to have gone through much.
皆の話によれば彼は偉い人らしい
According to all accounts, he seems to be a great man.
皆の話の合わぬ筋がある
The accounts are at variance with one another.
君の尋ねる人の詳しい話をしたらあるいは心当たりがあるかも知れぬ
If you will describe the person you want, I may be able to identify him.
話だけではわからない、現物を見たいものだ
I can form no idea from the description alone, and so I should like to see the article for myself.
彼の艱難辛苦の話をしたら大部の本ができよう
If he were to recount all his hardships, it would fill a big volume―A recital of his hardships would fill a big volume.
胸を掻きむしるような話
the harrowing details (of a murder, etc.)

content: 9. (=事、訳)a matter; a case

content.content: 話がどう運んでいるか
How does the matter stand?
話がまだそこまで運んでいない
The matter is not yet so far advanced.
そうなると話が違う
That alters the case.
話をきめてもらいたい
I with to have the matter settled.
まじめな話を茶にしては困る
You must not make light of a serious matter.
(こんな物を本物だとは)ずいぶん人をばかにした話だ
It is an insult to one's understanding.
三年待てとは人をばかにした話だ
Wait three years? He is trifling with me.
無給で働けとはばかばかしい話だ
Work for nothing? It is absurd―It is simply nonsense.
殴られて謝れとは無法な話だ
Apologize for being thrashed? It is preposterous.

content: 10. (=計画)a plan; a scheme

content.content: 雲をつかむような話だ
It is a visionary scheme―a chimerical scheme.
虫の好過ぎる話だ
His plan is too selfish.
お話にならぬ(言語道断)
It is unspeakable―unutterable.
その傲慢無礼といったらお話にならぬ
His insolence is atrocious.
彼の発音といったらお話にならぬ
His pronunciation is atrocious―outrageous.
ドイツ兵の残忍なことはお話にならぬ
The cruelty of the Germans is monstrous.
値段はお話にならぬ
The price is exorbitant.
先方の要求はお話にならぬ
His demands are preposterous.
お話にならぬ失錯をした
I have committed an egregious blunder.
道が悪いといったらお話にならぬ
The roads are execrable.
お話にならない匂いだ
It has a vile smell.
お話にならないいやな味だ
It has a villainous taste.
内部の乱脈といったらお話にならぬ
The internal disorder is unspeakable―unutterable.
イヤハヤどうもとてもお話にならぬ
Well, well, well, it is simply unspeakable.
お話を承って安心致しました
You have relieved me of my anxiety―You have removed a load off my mind.
お話を承って誤りを悟りました
You have convinced me of my error.
お話を承って疑いを氷解しました
You have dispelled my doubts.

content:
はなしあい〔話合い〕
〈名〉Common consent; understanding

content.content: 夫婦は話合いで別れた
The couple separated by common consent.
始め提携する時に一方の望みによってはいつでも別れるという話合いで提携したのだ
We joined hands on the understanding that we should separate at any time by the desire of either party.

content:
はなしあいて〔話し相手〕
〈名〉One's interlocutor; a crony; some one to talk to

content.content: 話し相手が無い
I have no one to talk to.
話し相手が欲しい
I want some one to talk to.
老人は話し相手が必要だ
An old man must have his crony.
老人二人は好い話し相手だ
The two old men are cronies.

はなしあう〔話し合う〕
〈自動〉To consult with (each other); to talk counsel

content:
はなしか〔落語家〕
〈名〉A (professional) story-teller; a raconteur

content.content: 落語家は世間の
The story-teller lives upon
あらで飯を食い
The faults of men beneath the sun.

content:
はなしがい〔放し飼い〕
〈名〉Pasturage

content.content: 馬を放し飼いにする
to pasture horses―put horses to pasture―turn out horses to grass―leave horses to roam at will
馬は放し飼いにしてある
The horses are in pasture―at grass―left to roam at will.

はなしかける〔話し掛ける〕
〈他動〉To speak to (one); to address (a person); to accost (a stranger, etc.)

content:
はなしごえ〔話し声〕
〈名〉Voices in conversation

content.content: 大勢の話し声がする
I hear many people talking.

content:
はなしじょうず〔話し上手〕
〈名〉A good talker; a good story-teller

content.content: 君は話し上手だ
You are a good hand at telling stories―a capital hand at spinning yarns.

content:
はなしずき〔話し好き〕
〈形〉Talkative, communicative, loquacious (person); chatty (woman); gossipy, garrulous (old folk)

content.content: 老人は話し好きなものだ
Old folks are garrulous.
あの人はたいへん話し好きだ
He is very talkative―a great talker.

content:
はなしずく〔話しずく〕
〈名〉Common consent

content.content: 夫婦は話しずくで別れた
The couple separated by common consent.

はなしちゅう〔話し中〕
〈熟語〉Engaged!; Line's busy!

content:
はなしべた〔話し下手〕
〈名〉A poor talker; a poor story-teller

content.content: 僕は話し下手で
I am a poor hand at telling stories―not much of a hand at spinning yarns.

はなしょうじ〔鼻障子〕
〈名〉The septum (of the nose)

はなしょうぶ〔花菖蒲〕
〈名〉The iris

content:
はなす〔放す〕
〈他動〉To let go, release, relinquish, quit, loose (one's hold); to let go of, leave hold of, disengage, free (one's hand); to set (birds or fishes) free; to let (a bird) go; to let (a dog) loose; to turn out (a horse to grass)

content.content: 葬式で鳥を放す
Birds are set free at funerals.
可哀そうにその鳥を放してやれ
Set the poor bird free!―Let the poor bird go!
この鳥は放してやると独りで帰って来る
If I let the bird fly away, it will come back of its own accord.
牧場に馬を放す
to put a horse to pasture―turn out a horse to grass―leave a horse to roam at will
握った手を放す
(自分の手なら)to let go one's hold―release one's hold―relinquish one's hold―quit one's hold―loose one's hold―(人の手なら)―let go of one's hand―leave hold of one's hand―disengage one's hand―free one's hand
そこ放せ
Let go your hold!
手を放せ
Let go of my hand!
ちょっと手が放されぬ
I can't leave my work―I am engaged just now.
あの男は握ったら放さぬ
He holds fast whatever he seizes on―grips like a vice.
喰付いたら放さぬ
He grips like a bull-dog.
死んでも放さぬ
He holds on like grim death.
あの人はいつも徳利を放さぬ
He always keeps a bottle at his elbow.
いつも本を放さぬ
He is never without his book―He never lays down his book―He is a steady reader.
この字書はちょっとも放されぬ
This dictionary is my constant companion―I must always have it ready to hand―I must always have it ready for reference.

content:
はなす〔離す〕
〈他動〉To disjoin (the parts―one part from another); to disconnect (the line from the battery); to disunite (the members of a family―one member from the others); to detach (the engine from the train); to separate (husband and wife―husband from wife); to estrange (parent and child―parent from child); to alienate (friends―friend from friend); to sever (the head from the trunk); to sunder (a limb from the stock); to keep (male and female) apart

content.content: 首を切り離す
to sever the head from the trunk
列車から機関車を離す
to detach the train from the locomotive
雄と雌を離す
to separate male and female
雄と雌を離しておけ
Keep male and female apart―Keep the male apart from the female.
机を離して置く
Place the desks apart from each other―Leave spaces between the desks.
火鉢をもっと離しておけ
Place the braziers farther apart (from each other)
魚を火から離しておけ
Place the fish away from the fire.
花を離して植える
Leave spaces between the flowers―Plant the flowers apart from each other.
一組になっているのだから一つ離して売ることはできません(離して売ると後が半端になります)
I can not break the set.
一対になっているのだから一つ離して売ることはできません(離して売ると半端になります)
I can not break the pair.
あの人はいつも徳利を離さぬ
He always keeps a bottle at his elbow.
あの人はいつも本を離さぬ
He is never without his book―He never lays down his book―He is a steady reader.
この字書はちょっとも離されぬ
This dictionary is my constant companion―I must always have it ready to hand―I must always have it ready for reference.
今ちょっと手が離されぬ
I can not leave my work―I am engaged just now.
この子は(いたずらで)ちょっとも目が離されぬ
You can't take your eyes off this child for a moment.

content:
はなす〔話す〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=人と話す)to speak, talk, chat, converse (with a person)

content.content: 彼と一晩話した
I talked with him―chatted with him―all night.
君と話したいことがある
I wish to have a talk with you.
ゆっくり話したい
I wish to have a long talk with you.
ちょっと話ししたいことがある
I want to have a word with you.
ちょっと内証でお話ししたい
A word with you (in private)!
ちと話しに来給え
Come for a chat sometimes!
昨晩友人のところへ話しに行った
I had a chat with a friend―went for a chat with a friend―last evening.
二時間話した
I had a two hours' chat with him.
面白く話した
I had a pleasant chat with him.
まだ早いからもっと話して行き給え
Stay a little longer, it is still early.
話す言葉も後や先き
He got confused in his talk―got mixed up.

content: 2. (=何を話す)to tell (one's story); to relate (one's experience); narrate (an event); to recount (one's adventures); to state (one's reason); to explain (one's reason)

content.content: わけを話す
to state one's reason―tell one's story
わけを話したら承知するかも知れぬ
If you explain your reason, he may consent.
主人に会って訳を話した
I saw the master of the house, and told my story.
僕の経験したことを話そう
I will relate my experiences―recount what I have seen and heard and felt.
彼の艱難辛苦を話したら大部の本ができよう
If he were to recount the hardships he has gone through, it would fill a big volume―A recital of his hardships would fill a big volume.

content: 3. (=誰に何を話す)to tell (one something); to speak (to one of something)

content.content: 君に話しておきたいことがある
I have something to tell you.
事の次第をかいつまんで話そう
I will tell you briefly how matters stand.
近頃帰朝した人のことをいつか君に話したね
I spoke to you the other day of a man just returned from abroad.
君はいつか良い家があることを話したね
You spoke to me some time ago of a good house.

content: 4. (=外国語を話す)to speak, talk (a foreign language)

content.content: 彼は英語をよく話す
He speaks English well―He is a good speaker of English.
あの人は五六カ国の語を話す
He speaks several languages.
三カ国の語を一様に話す人は語学の天才だ
He is a linguistic genius who speaks three languages equally well.

content: 5. (=秘密な事を話す)to tell, disclose, divulge, reveal (a secret); to confide (a secret to one); to unburden oneself of, disburden one's heart of (a secret to a person)

content.content: 君にぜひ話しておきたいことがある
There is something I must confide to you―disclose to you.
これは君だけに話すのだ
I confide this to you alone―This is for your private ears.
親にも兄弟にも話せないことだ
It is a secret from my nearest relations.

content: 6. (=如何に話す)to speak (how?)

content.content: 彼は英語をすらすら話す
He speaks English fluently―He is a fluent speaker of English.
用心して話すがよい
You ought to speak guardedly―use guarded language.
遠慮無く、腹蔵なく、忌憚無く話し給え
You may speak without reserve.
よどみ無く話す
to speak without hitch or pause―tell the story off the reel
包み隠さず話す
to speak the plain truth―tell the downright truth
ザックバランに話す
to be outspoken―free-spoken
身ぶりをして話す
to suit the action to the word

content: 7. (=くわしく話す)to describe (a person or a thing)

content.content: 君の無くした時計はどんな時計だか詳しく話してみ給え、そうしたらわかるかも知れぬ
If you will describe the watch you have lost,―tell me what it is like,―I may be able to find it.
君の尋ねる人はどんな人だかくわしく話したらあるいは心当たりがあるかも知れぬ
If you will describe the man you want, I may be able to identify him.
その機械はどんなものだかざっと話してみ給え
Will you roughly describe the machine?―give me a general idea of the machine?
はなせる〔話せる〕

content:
はなすじ〔鼻筋〕
〈名〉(Literally) the profile of the nose (but representative of all the features of the face)

content.content: 鼻筋が通って口元尋常
He has regular features.

はなずもう〔花相撲〕
〈名〉Ordinary wrestling-matches (as opposed to the Annual Matches)

content:
はなせる〔話せる〕
〈形〉(A person) worth talking to; sensible (person)

content.content: あれは話せる男だ
He is a man of sense―a sensible fellow.
なかなか話せる
He has good sense―sound sense―strong sense―sterling sense―plenty of sense―much to say for himself.
君も話せるようになった
You have become quite sensible.
君も生ネギを食うか、そいつぁ話せる
You eat raw onions, do you? Well, that is very sensible of your―that shows sense.

content:
はなたけ〔鼻茸〕
〈名〉A nasal polypus

content.content: 鼻茸を取る
to remove a nasal polypus

content:
はなだけ〔鼻茸〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: はなたけ〔鼻茸〕

はなたて〔花立て〕
〈名〉A bamboo flower-vase (set in front of a grave)

content:
はなだて〔花立て〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: はなたて〔花立て〕

はなたば〔花束〕
〈名〉A nosegay; a bouquet

はなたらし〔洟垂らし〕
〈名〉A snivelling child; a snotty urchin

はなたれこぞう〔洟垂れ小僧〕
〈名〉
1. A snivelling child; a snotty urchin
2. (=青二才)a stripling

content:
はなぢ〔鼻血〕
〈名〉Nosebleed

content.content: 鼻血が出る
My nose bleeds―I bleed at the nose.
逆さにしても出るものは鼻血くらいのものだ
He has not a cent in the world.

content:
はなつ〔放つ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=発射する)to discharge, let off, fire, shoot (a gun); to shoot, let fly (an arrow); to let drive(は自動詞); to launch (a missile)

content.content: 鉄砲を放つ
to discharge a gun―let off a gun―fire a gun―shoot a gun―let drive
矢を放つ
to discharge an arrow―shoot an arrow―let fly an arrow
土人が矢の雨を放った
The natives let fly a shower of arrows.
今日は一発も放つ機会を得なかった
I haven't had a shot today.

content: 2. (=発する)to emit, radiate (light or heat); to give out, shed (perfume); to send forth (fragrance); to give off, puff out (smoke); to utter (a cry)

content.content: 光を放つ
to emit light―shine forth
光彩を放つ
to be brilliant
異彩を放つ
to shine (in society)―cut a conspicuous figure
彼は目から火を放つ
His eyes flash fire.
汽船は黒煙を放って走る
A steamer puffs out black smoke as she runs.
香気を放つ
to give out perfume―send forth fragrance―shed perfume around
臭気を放つ、悪臭を放つ
to emit a smell―give out a smell―send forth a stench―stink

content: 3. (=放す)to let loose, turn loose (a caged animal); to cast loose, cast off (an animal in leash); set free (a bird)

content.content: 猟犬を放つ
to cast loose a hound―cast off a hound―slip a hound
鷹を放つ
to cast off a hawk
市に虎を放つ
to let loose a tiger on a crowd
かかる悪漢を世に出すのは市に虎を放つようなものだ
It is dangerous to turn loose such men on society.
兵禍を放つ
to let loose the dogs of war(=sword, fire, and famine)
よくよくのことでなければ兵禍を放つものでない
All peaceable means must be exhausted before letting loose the dogs of war.

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 火を放つ
to set fire to a house or a town
敵は民家に火を放って逃げた
The enemy set fire to the houses before retreating.
攻撃を放つ
to launch an attack
間諜を放つ
to send out spies
間諜を放って敵の動静を探らした
Spies were sent out to watch the movements of the enemy.
流言を放つ
to set rumours afloat―circulate canards
暴言を放つ
to break out into violent language―lash out into violent language―utter wild words―let fly a torrent of abuses―(人に向ってなら)―rave against one―rage against one

はなつき〔鼻付き〕
〈名〉The shape of one's nose

はなつくり〔花作り〕
〈名〉(事)floriculture:(人)a floriculturist; a florist

content:
はなっぱり〔鼻っ張り〕
〈名〉Brag; bluster

content.content: 江戸っ子は鼻っ張りが強い
The Edokko is a braggart―a blusterer.
鼻っ張りばかり強い
He is great only in brag.

content:
はなつまみ〔鼻摘み〕
〈名〉(事)disgust; loathing:(人)a disgusting fellow; a loathsome fellow

content.content: 人を鼻つまみにする
to hold a man in disgust―loathe a man
鼻つまみにされる
to be held in disgust―be loathed
あの男は鼻つまみだ
He is a disgusting fellow―a loathsome fellow.

はなづら〔鼻面〕
〈名〉The muzzle (of a horse, etc.)

content:
はなでんしゃ〔花電車〕
〈名〉An illumination car; a floral car

content.content: 今晩花電車が出る
Illuminated cars will be out this evening.

content:
はなどき〔花時〕
〈名〉The flowery season; the cherry season

content.content: この辺は花時は賑います
The neighbourhood is thronged with people in the cherry season.

content:
はなのした〔鼻の下〕
〈名〉Under the nose; the mouth

content.content: 鼻の下が長い
to be susceptible to female charms
鼻の下を伸ばす
to be spooney on a girl
鼻の下が干上がる
to starve

はなのひ〔花の日〕
〈名〉The flower-day

content:
はなばしら〔鼻梁〕
〈名〉The bridge (of the nose)

content.content: 鼻ばしらを折る(挫く)
to humiliate a proud man―humble his pride―snub him

content:
はなはだ〔甚だ〕
〈副〉Very (beautiful); much (pleased); greatly (pained); highly (pleased, etc.)

content.content: 甚だ好し
Very good!
甚だ迷惑だ
I am greatly annoyed.
君には甚だ失望した
I am very much disappointed in you.
君は半途にして学業を廃するのは甚だ惜しむべきことだ
It is a great pity that you should give up your studies half-way.

はなばたけ〔花畑〕
〈名〉A flower-bed

content:
はなはだしい〔甚しい〕
〈形〉Gross (mistake); crass (ignorance); glaring (error); egregious (folly); crying (disgrace); burning (shame); sore (distress); flagrant (offence); heinous (crime); deadly (sin); oppressive (heat); bitter (cold); vile (taste or smell); execrable (roads); atrocious (insolence); outrageous (pronunciation); exorbitant (price); preposterous (demands); notorious (vice); excessive (economy); extreme (timidity); intense (heat or cold)

content.content: 暑気甚だし
The heat is intense―It is oppressively hot.
寒気甚だし
The cold is intense―It is bitterly cold.
甚だしい誤りだけは直しておいた
I have corrected gross mistakes―glaring errors.
これは甚だしい恥辱だ
This is burning shame―a crying disgrace.
彼は甚だしく愚かだ
He shows crass stupidity―egregious folly.
愚かも甚だし
Such is his folly!―What folly!
甚だしい愚物だ
He is an egregious ass.
甚だしい失錯をしたものだ
He has committed an egregious blunder.
甚だしい無学だ
He shows crass ignorance.
甚だしい発言だ
It is outrageous pronunciation―atrocious pronunciation.
彼は甚だしく窮している
He is in sore need.
道徳の頽廃日に甚だし
The depravity of morality daily grows greater.
道徳の頽廃今日より甚だしきは無し
Never was morality more depraved.
富豪の奢侈は日に甚だし
The luxury of the rich daily grows greater.
奢侈今日より甚だしきは無し
Never before did luxury reach such a height.
甚だしき哉富豪の奢侈
Such is the luxury of the rich!
罪悪これより甚だしきは無し
No crime can be more heinous―No sin can be more deadly.

はなはだしきにいたっては

content:
はなはだしきにいたっては〔甚しきに至っては〕
〈副〉In extreme cases; even

content.content: 甚だしきに至っては鍋釜を質に入れる者さえある
Some people even pawn their pots and pans.
甚だしきに至っては妻子を棄てる者さえある
Some even go so far as to desert their wives and families.
甚だしきに至っては一食に百円費す者がある
Some go so far as to give―go the length of giving―a hundred yen for a meal.
甚だしきに至っては彼らは世間の迷惑を悦ぶ
They even take a malicious pleasure in annoying the public.
甚だしきに至っては財産を悉く失う
They lose their all in extreme cases.

content:
はなはだしく〔甚しく〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: はなはだ〔甚だ〕

content:
はなばなしい〔華々しい〕
〈形〉Brilliant (wit); glorious (death); splendid (victory); spectacular (effect); pyrotechnical (scene); sensational (success, etc.)

content.content: 華々しい演説をした
He made a brilliant speech.
華々しい戦死を遂げた
He died a glorious death in battle.
華々しい働きぶりであった
He showed splendid behaviour.
今の戦争は華々しいところが無い
Modern warfare lacks spectacular effect.
江戸っ子は華々しいお祭り騒ぎが好きだ
The Edokko loves pyrotechnical pageantry.
彼は華々しく成功した
He has achieved a sensational success.
彼は華々しく結婚式を挙げた
His marriage was celebrated with great ?clat.

content:
はなばん〔鼻番〕
〈名〉The next on the list

content.content: 鼻番を呼べ
Call the next man on the list.
鼻番は誰だ
Whose turn is it?
